product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Dajaab
content: I don't understand why so much bad reviews ? I received this cam today, already installed at my front door, connected with Ring app... It was so easy ! Picture is clear, 1080HD, wired with my previous bell switch, no worries about the battery... Set up with Ring app takes 10 seconds, same for Alexa, same with my Fridge Samsung Family hub... again, so easy Only one thing matters, a good WiFi. It's the key !  I use 3 Eero pro so I have a strong Wifi everywhere inside and outside of my home but you can also use the Ring Chime pro, less expensive then Eero. It works well, I confirm and I was not paid for this review.
title: Very happy with this $100 door bell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: User
content: I had the original Ring Doorbell for about a year and really enjoyed it. It was cheap but lower quality video resolution. It was fine for the time I had it. When the same thing with improved video was being released, I jumped on it. I received it today and got it installed. The video quality is night and day as shown in the photos and much better than the 1st generation. Good work ring. Unfortunately, the installation and mounting sucks compared to the 1st generation. Why they did this, I have no clue but here are the issues. 1. The mounting plate on the first generation has connections for the wiring. This made it very easy to remove the device and charge, especially in the winter months where we live and the batteries lose charge. 2nd generation has a mounting plate and the wiring on the back of the unit, which was a pain especially when the existing wire is not very long. This will be a nightmare having to remove this and recharge compared to the 1st generation. I had no issues with the 1st generation. This is a failure for Ring in my opinion. I am debating about keeping my 1st  generation instead of this now. 2. The mounting of the device to the frame also sucks. The 1st literally had no gaps and was secure in my opinion. It had guides that made the doorbell align to the mount. The 2nd generation does not and there are gaps all the way around and loose. I mounted it no differently than before, in fact the holes for 1st and 2nd generation are identical which is a plus, but again I see this mounting as a failure for Ring. I literally just installed this, and outside of the perfect video, I can’t attest to motion and nightvision yet. I am disappointed in the execution of mounting the device. I have no idea why this changed this from the 1st generation but this was a bad move in my opinion. I still have no idea why these require a battery they never stay charged when connected to wiring, but I assume this unit will have the same issue for me as well come winter. They really need to rethink the whole battery idea and have a hardwired version and battery version or fix the way these thing function when power is applied. At this point I may deal with it and hope Ring fixes these mounting and wiring flaws. If this mounted the same way as the 1st generation, I would not be writing a review because I had no issues with the device other than the battery and that wasn’t enough for me to write a review. Excellent otherwise but seriously why did you change the way these mount? ***Update 6/6/2020*** So I decided to keep it primarily because I had already offered to sell my 1st generation to a neighbor, but I did end up having to make some changes. Ultimately I bought some spade terminals and soldered them to my doorbell wire with heat shrink tubing (Ring provided in older versions, but not this one for some reason). While it was easy for me, it won’t be for others. Overall I am still upset over this mounting as it is extremely poor execution when the previous version was perfect. I guess this is Rings way to get the price down to $99 by cutting corners. The doorbell it self seems quality but mounting just plain sucks. I have no other words for it. You can see my updated photos of what I did. There are two photos that show the camera quality difference. The low quality image is from a generation 1 ring and the better quality HD is from the generation 2 ring. Night vision appears to be decent and motion the jury is still out because of the People only filter. I am still trying to tweak it. I am still leaving only 3 stars because of the mounting issues and there is still a gap between the mounting plate and the doorbell. Maybe Ring will fix and send everyone a new mount, but that is wishful thinking.
title: Better video quality, poor installation and mounting (Updated 6/6/2020)

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: sean branstetter
content: Returning this device after waiting over a month for it and now I’m mad. The way it comes you can’t even install on vinyl siding because there is no bracket to hold it off the uneven surface. Then they moved the wiring bolts to the back of the device itself so if you have shorter wires it’s impossible to connect. I’ve seen the first gen ring doorbell and they changed everything about it. Why make a product that you can’t mount and not include the right mounting brackets that’s stupid.
title: Mounting on vinyl is impossible

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: logchief
content: Misleading and very displeased...I expected a battery removal but now realizing that it’s called 2 gen meaning not the ring 2 with removal battery...RIDICULOUS!!!! Now I have a additional battery I bought that I can’t use...pissed off!
title: Misleading on battery!!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Christopher
content: Image in product listing is of matte/solid color (I already own one of these in Venetian Bronze, and it looks like the product image here). The device I received has a texture to it and the finish has a faux-sandblasted quality to it with antique copper faux highlights mimicking lighting effects (I suppose) which does not match the image in the product description or the image on the box itself. It is NOT unattractive, all I am saying is it doesn't look anything at all like the image (originally) posted to this product listing or the image on the box, both of which depict a  smooth and consistent matte gray. I also did not realize Ring 2nd Gen is NOT the Ring 2, which has been consistently referred to everywhere as the 2nd generation of the Ring doorbell, just as most people are referring to the Ring 3 as the third generation. The branding is terribly confusing and I think Amazon should brace for a LOT of returns from customers who presume, as I did, that I was ordering an update of Ring 2 and will be disappointed to discover the battery is not swappable inf R2G. That’s not why I sent it back, I sent it back b/c it was hideous (individual tastes will vary of course). A much better name for the device would be “Ring 1 (Second Generation)”. That’s MUCH clearer. Returned.
title: Product Looks NOTHING Like This

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mr Richie
content: Well where do i begin? I thought i was ordering the one with the removable battery but it was this one instead. I guess i'll hard wire it so i don't have to babysit my doorbell battery wise. Good 1080p Hd Video. good sound that comes put of the door bell (your voice). I also ordered the "All new ring chime pro" Only because it doubles as a door bell & a router extender. Have fun with it & stay safe.
title: Hmmmmm....

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: JLO
content: New Design Ring gen 2 is NOT backwards compatible with anything but the app  , battery is built in , mounting brackets are different size , hell even the screw driver is different , I was looking forward to having the ring video doorbell 2 only to find out it is anything but the ring video doorbell 2 It is a totally different everything , You have to remove the entire camera to charge it also.
title: why change a good thing

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Ashley
content: I've been using the ring doorbell for about 6 weeks now. Overall, the performance is very poor compared to other ring devices. I use the ring security system and monitoring inside of my home, and figured adding the doorbell would be a good addition based on my success with their other products. However, the doorbell all around is ineffective and an embarrassment to the company. Installing and setting up with the instructions is pretty straight forward. It took three separate attempts to connect to my phone and app before it finally did though. The picture quality is good for both day and night. The doorbell DOES NOT pick up on most motion though. It DOES NOT even pick up my mail carrier putting mail into my mailbox, which is directly next to the doorbell on my porch. Not only does it not register motion, but it sends NO notifications to my phone. I've tried reconnecting the doorbell to my app and wifi, tried downloading the ring app again, changed settings in my phone, done everything I can think of but still cant get it to work. Overall - the doorbell doesnt register motion, doesn't record motion, and doesnt give notifications. SO IT IS USELESS.
title: USELESS - doesnt record motion or give notifications.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Danielle Cadier
content: Works great and looks great. Took 10 minutes to update and 5 to install.
title: Looks and works great.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Britt
content: This is my first Ring doorbell. I followed the instructions (which were quite thorough) for an easy hardwire setup. I played with the settings for a while until I managed to find the right setup for me. The sensitivity is surprisingly accurate and the quality of video is pretty good for what it is. No issues here.
title: About what I expected

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Victor Lee
content: This is the 2nd generation ring not the ring 2. I got confused and bought a spare battery. It turns out you can’t change the battery. So that kinda sucks but I am also one of those people without doorbell wiring and stuck with battery. But it all works fine - very easy setup and they provided a drill bit too - which surprised me.
title: Ring 2nd gen NOT ring 2. Battery can’t be changed.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Rick grimes
content: Update..... After writing this review I was contacted by Max of the ring team. He has bent over backwards helping me solve the problem. Customer service is amazing. I would give 5 stars for that. I will update again if problem is solved. I am not impressed with this product. I have a porch connected to the front door. I installed the ring doorbell and the only time I see someone come is when they are right at the door or the first step. And most of the time I can see them leaving. It was recommended that I buy the wedge and that did not do anything as well. I tried multiple points on where to install it and different heights. Finally I found the height that I wanted because I was able to see on my lawn if someone came. I kept testing it for hours.but the next day I went right back to only getting it if someone was right on my step. I wanted more than that I wanted to see people deliver my packages. I don't want them right at my door I want a heads-up. This will help if you want to catch someone if they go right to the door but if you want to see them coming forget about it.
title: Good only of you want to see someone right at the door

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Marvina Mayhugh
content: Have had this up for a few days. Won’t stay connected to the Internet bought extenders. And still no connection. Keeps dropping if this keeps up I’m returning it.
title: Not happy

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: manatee
content: Prior to purchasing, I watched several videos showing how to install the Ring Doorbell.  This unit does not utilize the same instructions as the original unit. Videos implied that I could expect the unit to be shipped with a mounting wedge, mounting screws, screw driver, wire extensions and a diode.  This unit did not come with the mounting wedge, wire extensions or diode.  I needed to mount the doorbell on an angle so ordered a separate mounting wedge  I managed to wire the unit with the existing wiring,but installion would have been easier if extensions were available. Apparently the diode is not required with this unit since the written instructions do not mention it. Bottom line, the unit was easy to install and set up.  I am please with it’s operation..
title: Not quite the same as shown on instructional videos

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kandice
content: I had written a more detailed review, but Amazon wouldn't post it. The doorbell only records 20 seconds worth of video when motion is detected. It's not long enough to even see a delivery happen in full. There's no way to change this, per my call with ring support. I am returning this and the one I ordered for my mom as soon as that one comes.
title: Only records 20 seconds of video

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: LP
content: My original Ring has been OK enough that two years later I decided to add a Ring 2 because it was on sale. Today, 30 days later, I get the “your trial has ended” message. I thought the trial was just to keep videos in the cloud. Instead, this camera is now rendered useless for anything but live viewing. Plus I now am getting “this video is unavailable” for Neighbors posted videos. My original Ring was even cut off from recording! After two years! Complete waste of money. On top of that, this stupid camera hasn’t caught motion unless the person/subject is doing somersaults a few feet in front of the camera. *Do Not Buy!* I want a refund, Amazon! Not happy at all.
title: RIPOFF! Paid subscription is mandatory to utilize anything but live view

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Nomore privacy
content: Update:  after "using" for about a month I took another star off.  Motion detection is worthless.  I get notifications but by the time I can log on whatever the motion was is long gone.  Look at the recording--no good either nothing there.  I am certainly NOT going to pay $3 per month in perpetuity for this (almost) useless device. I DO NOT recommend. Wanted to like more obviously.  The reaction time is so long that without paying $3 per month there is no way to ever see what caused the motion alarm.  I don't really want to pay forever.  Wish I hadn't purchased it to replace a cheap camera that recorded and saved video for free.  Camera is fairly good just as a camera.  Also they start three free trial when they ship or when it arrives but not when it's first installed so I missed out a week or so.
title: Meh

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: robert moore
content: i love my ring video door bell..it has night vision witch looks awesome..i was about 80 miles from my home it my phone went off showing me that someone was at my front door..it rings 3 places on my phone on my computer and at the door..it's just awesome to feel safe at night..and it records every thing..it was so easy to hook up to my doorbell wires...they give you extra parts and it helps you get started with a push of a button on the back...
title: room with a view

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Ross King
content: Buyer beware!  There is a subscription fee this device.  And it is tiered based on the number of devices you have.  I bought our first one without seeing the subscription fee.  Bought the second one seeing that there is a subscription fee but thought the original subscription would cover the second door bell.  IT DOES NOT.  I pay 36 dollars a year for the first device and now will need to pay 100 dollars a year for two.  We are going to sell these off and go with Nest or another door bell.  Motion detector doesn't work well and the night vision is not great.  I do not recommend this door bell or service.
title: SUBSCRIPTION FEES

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Clifford P.
content: Expectations on delivery. Reviews from consumers on this particular item date of reviews and date of purchase. I'm hoping as a consumer and I will review when received that this is truely the New gen doorbell.
title: Product reliability

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: aaMichael
content: Initially, I was pleased with my purchase. Ordered what I thought would be an additional battery. Installation was a breeze, setup without a hitch. 3 days later, battery down to 30%. I took my freshly charged "additional battery downstairs to make the exchange, only to find out I have been hoodwinked and bamboozled... battery is irreplaceable; entire unit has to be removed and connected to usb power source. Errrr
title: Battery is not replaceable

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Suwanee Mom
content: UPDATE: I am equally disappointed to learn that you MUST purchase the subscription plan. I thought it was optional, but you aren't able to see the video recordings without the plan. Maybe I missed it, but it seems like once you buy the product you're forced to pay additional for the subscription. Again, not like my Arlo cameras; the videos are just emailed to me - no need for cloud storage. Orig Review: So regretting buying this. I use Arlo cameras and thought the Ring doorbell would give me another level of security, but it was a huge regret. First the motion is off, I've watched the YouTube videos and instructional videos to fix it, but I only get people walking away. The angle shows directly in front and then the entire skyline, not my porch and packages below. I've read there's some angle device I can buy to add-on, but why bother when it doesn't hold a wifi signal. I even moved my wifi extender near the front door, but whenever I go for live view it's processing... so frustrating! Everything is so delayed that it's pointless to have honestly. The night view is so dark that I don't even try to look when the alerts go off at night. I just roll over in bed and pray no one is breaking in because Ring won't show me anything useful and I have my porch light on. I have my Ring hardwired, but it still loses battery frequently, even when I decreased my motion settings. I feel like it was a waste of time, effort and money. Very disappointed and I know they can do better.
title: Does Not Live Up to the Hype

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mr. Crunchy
content: I’m not a tech nerd, but fairly handy. Set up is easy, install is easy. If you are wiring into an existing doorbell connection, yes the old doorbell wires keep the battery charged and keep it running. You only have to do the initial install charge. Took a while to tinker with the motion detection sensitivity and notifications, but they work well. The annual Ring fee for being able to watch “past” events and share videos is $30/yr. If you don’t subscribe, you can only watch live. Unit is pretty big (that’s what she said), so make sure you have a space to physically install it.
title: Easy set up, works well

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Rosi Fig
content: I was very excited to receive this ring doorbell, but I am a little disappointed. Let start with the positive things: the picture quality is very good, even night time. The set up is very straightforward and the installation very easy. Not so good: the motion detector is not very reliable. Sometimes works, sometimes don't. Has a delay of about 10 seconds to advise you of the motion. The other day a guy from Amazon was delivering a package and when I receive the motion notification he was already in the truck and record him get in the truck and leaving. What the heck!!! what is the point of the camera if I can't see the person's face!!! Also the app saying that doorbell has a poor connection to my wifi. I don't know why. I first connect to my router and when I see the bad signal I changed to my extender that is literally 5 feet from the doorbell. All my other devices works perfectly and have a great connection with extender, except the doorbell. Contact ring and they said I should buy the ring chime pro wifi extender. What for if I already have a extender close to the doorbell?? More money to spend!! No sense and not very happy!! Also be aware you have to take off from wall to charge the battery if it is not connect wired.
title: Motion sensor not very reliable!!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: New Mrs JR
content: Bought this to replace our older version. The frame is wider but it definitely is not an upgrade as far as motion detection. Sometimes I get a notification but nothing is in the frame. Other notifications I get is from when the person is already walking away, or them actually already ringing the doorbell. It hardly ever picks up people walking up to the door or even standing on the porch. Might as well not have it cuz it won’t catch anything anyway. Edited to add: apparently (from what we were told, did not get to try it out) it works better if it’s set up at an angle. We had it on top of our doorbell which is directly next to the door and not angled. Max from support was very helpful in troubleshooting this product but we still ended up switching to a Google Nest and it is AMAZING.
title: Not an upgrade

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sitpaintandplay
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. I’m not gonna lie I was super excited about getting this app and the device that goes with it but so far it really has impressed me all that much there are some days I can walk literally straight up to my door open the door and walk inside and I’ll never catch me once but then the neighbors cat can walk across the street and then I’ll pick that up on the backside of the house.I’m not gonna lie I was super excited about getting this app and the device that goes with it but so far it really hasn’t impressed me all that much there are some days I can walk literally straight up to my door open the door and walk inside and I’ll never catch me once but then the neighbors cat can walk across the street and it’ll pick that up on the backside of their house But then there are other days it’ll pick up every single car that drives by 65 times in our neighborhood and go off 150 times and run his battery out. So all in all it’s just super inconsistent and the things you want to catch it doesn’t catch like a while back someone stole a package and I never picked it up but then like I said little worthless things like my neighbors cat or me casually just walking across the yard or something like that it’ll pick up.
title: Hit or miss but mostly miss

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Cindy
content: This really grinds my gears. The product design on this new "improved" version of the original ring doorbell is so baffling to me. While the set up was easy, I don't understand why they would change the wall plate set up. I had my original doorbell hard wired to my existing doorbell. I did not want to worry about charging it. That said, my wifi connection tends to go offline quite a lot, thanks to Comcast, who happens to be the only internet service provider in my area. And, many times I  have to remove the door bell to reset the network setting, which is something I should not have to do if Ring did not require it in their software design. Now with the new "improved" design, I can't just remove the doorbell, I have to unwire it as well. The existing doorbell wires are small and can only take so many rounds of maneuvering the wire before they wear out and break. Geese Ring, WTH, at lease with the old design I did not have to tinker with wires to reset the network after an internet outage or something. 🤬😡🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬.  If you wanted to improve the camera, did you really need to change the wall plate. Did you really need to change the way this thing physically connects to the building in order to get a better camera resolution. 🤬 I didn't have to drill any new holes, you got that part right. ***************************************************************************************************************** 10/3/2020 Just wanted to pop back on to review exactly what I already knew would happen. After a power outage for 5 days due to hurricane Laura, I had to reconnect my ring doorbell to wifi and go through all the set up steps again like new. First off, I have the original ring door bell that was redesigned and included updated features. Problem #1 I had to remove the door bell, press the orange button. What's wrong with that? I have my doorbell hard wired to my home to use my in home chime. The new design has the screws connected to the back of the doorbell. The old design had the screws for connecting to your home wires, to allow constant charging, connected to the wall plate. That was a design that Ring developers should have left alone. It was soooooo awkward and tedious trying to line the home wiring up with those tiny screws and a nut case job of trying to screw it all back together. If your home wires are short, good luck trying to pull this off. If you are the kind of person who likes to pop off a few cuss words at home projects that should be simple but turn out to be a frustrating time drain, this is not the doorbell for you. Why does making updates have to mean screw up the  parts that work. While I appreciate the 1080p video quality, I never had to bother the home wires on the old wall plate or the screws connecting my home doorbell wires. What a stupid, stupid idea. If I sound pissed I'm. I got it all connected, but it's totally coo coo crazy to have to go through in the first place. What a sick design!!! I could go on .. but seriously Ring what a crappy design.
title: Product design is flawed - This is on an upgrade to the original Ring doorbell.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: G Bean
content: Doesn't record long enough to get anything useful when you're actually being robbed. I was still actively being burglarized and it stopped at 20 seconds. Would have been nice to get a license plate....but no, guess that's not important.
title: Waste of money

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Matthew F.
content: Very easy to install. Very easy to use. Nice crystal clear picture. App is straight forward. I recommend hard wiring it, because battery life is very short. If you don't have existing door bell wiring, you can buy an AC power adapter on Amazon. I also LOVE the way it's tied to Alexa and she says "Someone is at the front door" when a visitor pushes the button.
title: Nice!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Erin Hayes
content: So pleased with this doorbell! We bought this because of recent activity in our neighborhood. I have to say that the motion detection on it is amazing. I had to adjust the motion ranges though because it kept picking up when our neighbor (directly across the road from us!) would open her door! I wouldn't be able to tell what "motion" it was picking up on at first, but when I zoomed in, I realized it detected motion THAT far away and had to reset the motion settings. I love the "people only" option that it has and it allows me to focus on what is truly important instead of having alerts every time a dog or cat runs across our yard. The customization of the motion settings and privacy settings have really come a long way since the Ring first came out and I'm very happy with the result.
title: Comforting and Helpful

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Matthew Vosburgh
content: I've got an original Ring 1 and a Ring 2, installed at different homes without trouble. My Ring 1 after some years was becoming unreliable and going offline so I ordered this "2020 version" Ring to replace it, actually thinking it was a Ring 2 on sale (the Amazon description was very vague).  It is in fact the 2nd generation of the Ring 1. It has a different mounting plate,  a fixed battery instead of a swappable one, is wired in differently etc. It's quite different from the gen 1 even though it looks very similar from the front. I open the box and see that the product is covered in warnings not to use the long screws supplied to attach the doorbell to the mounting plate, you must use the short security screws for that. Apparently some people have used the supplied long screws in the wrong holes, and pierced the internal battery, which is dangerous. Well that seems like bad design in the first place, not a problem you patch with warning stickers. I start the install. First problem is I can't remove my old Ring 1, as the special screws on the Ring 1 gen 2 are different, as is the supplied screwdriver. I call tech support and they tell me I need a TORX 6 screwdriver. A week later I come back to the house with a T6 and remove the old bell. Fitting the gen 2 is much more awkward than a gen 1 because it requires much greater length of free doorbell wire than the original, because you have to connect the wire to the doorbell itself, not to the mounting plate. This also makes it hard to take the gen 2 doorbell on and off, e.g. to charge the battery. I go and buy wire, connection screws, electrical tape, to extend the doorbell wiring. I wire up the doorbell.  Now it is hard to get it into place on its bracket because the required  loose wire behind it gets in the way, unlike the gen 1. Eventually I get the bell in place, press the button. It rings the elecronic chime, and notifies my phone but it does not ring the physical doorbell, which my Ring 1 and 2 both do. I check the connections but it still won't actually ring the physical doorbell, like every other Ring does. That's the last straw, I take the gen 2 off the wall to return it, remove its bracket, re-install the original Ring 1, which I think just needed a good charge on USB anyway. I tried to return the Ring gen 2, but I am past the return window. Well if I'm stuck with this cheap nasty version of what was once a good product, Amazon is stuck with this review.
title: Lower quality than other Ring doorbells

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Big Mike
content: Returned due to the fact that only 1 smartphone has full features access (2way communications) all other smartphones can hear but can't respond??? So I guess if you are single this would work for you and its NOT easy set up it took ALL of almost 5hours with ring customer assistance to only find out only the "OWNER" smartphone has 2way communications all others can not respond! to me it's not worth the hassles on the price I DON'T usually don't like to give a bad review but this is not what I would call a security system for a family setting
title: Do your research before purchasing a system

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Whylie
content: I got this 1 bc my original ones charging input got bad. I wished I'd have read these reviews 1st. By them changing the way it attaches to the new style mounting bracket you're able to get a fingernail between the unit and bracket and dislodge the entire unit leaving it apt to be broken off the wall. Why they felt changing the way it mounts would provide improved performance quality, they're sadly mistaken. I'm sending it back to Amazon for a refund and just wished I could find a 1st generation again. This isnt worth the time. I absolutely HATE this new "design", they really blew it.
title: Comes off the bracket with a fingernail in the gap.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: charles w.
content: Great product, don't  Waste time and effort on the other brands. Very easy install wired right in where my existing doorbell button was, I had to extend the wires Slightly but it was no big deal at all as I already had everything I needed to do it on hand.  The packaging did indicate but there were provided wire extenders but there was not, but thats definitely not a big deal considering you can even install it wirelesslyand just recharge it periodically.  As I said we already had a wired doorbell but if you do not it can be used with the battery and echo dots work well as chimes, So if you already have a dot and no wired doorbell you don't necessarily have to buy a chime to go with it, we use it so we can hear it in the laundry room or when I'm in the garage. We don't have amazing wifi and havent had issues with it connecting yet
title: does absolutely everything its supposed  to.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Nanci
content: EDITED 11/28/20 - After I posted this review, Max from Ring contacted me and worked very hard to fix the issues. First, he said I needed the New Ring Chime which is also a WiFi extender, since the improved video needs a stronger signal. Max sent me a complementary Chime and it did improve the WiFi range. I still did not like the way the motion zones were set up, but just recently it was apparently upgraded, because I can now adjust the zones where I want them (last photo)! It does  still pick up on large vehicles, but not very much. I’m very happy with it now and I appreciate Ring listening to its customers! I changed my review from 2 to 4 stars ⭐️ INITIAL REVIEW- (I purchased the original Ring doorbell a few months ago, was the 720p, it was satisfactory in the way it worked, but when I noticed I got one of the last 720p (that was discontinued shortly afterwards) and the 1080p was now the same price, Amazon let me return it and get the gen 2. Unfortunately, the picture is the only thing that’s better! The first one worked with my WiFi, this one keeps telling me it’s a very poor connection (doorbell, router, EVERYTHING is in the same place). So it doesn’t always pick up any motion. But it DOES pick up almost every car that goes by, no matter how I set it! The old one has a much easier way to set the motion zones- this one only shows 4 zones, on or off (second photo).That’s it. The gen 1 let you slide your zones in or out with your finger. When I watch the tutorial, it shows the more detailed motion settings (first photo)but I don’t have that. I’m sorry I ever got the new one- it’s essentially useless.)
title: Edited since initially reviewed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: The Godfather
content: I like the solid color as it is not so obvious. I'm happy after a couple weeks with the resolution, both daytime & night time. However I'm charging this thing for the third time already. Have turned down notifications and motion sensitivity, which I don't want to do. Going to note how long this charge works, but still, it's too short. Would be better with removable batteries and a spare. And, I know it may have been obvious to many, but it never dawned on me that although it's called a RING video DOORBELL, it doesn't have a BELL !  I don't walk around the house with my cellphone and can't hear knocks on the door downstairs. So we have to buy an add-on bell. It's my first Ring device. We all learn..
title: Nice color,short battery life

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Heather s
content: As a younger woman living in a city alone, my loving 100lb watch dog was not enough. Previously I had alarm systems that didn’t not quit match all that ring can do. I love the app features as far as being able to upload and view neighbors posted live feeds of suspicious activity & it even tells of activity in my neighborhood (fires, police calls, etc). I am now looking to purchase even more ring products. Thank you & I recommend.
title: Worth every cent.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: The tallest
content: I get alerts up to 5 minutes after bell is rung or motion is detected IF I get them at all at least half of alert recording are just a completely black screen when played back. This thing is utterly useless
title: Absolutely useless as Software is complete crap

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: joseph b.
content: App hardly works, barely ever can communicate with the device, all alerts are late by 30-60min, live view doesn't load, motion detection is insanely sensitive to the point it goes off with no visible movement. I've essentially bought a very expensive doorbell because none of the other features work properly.
title: Waste of money

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: OrlandoAlan
content: Doorbell would notify me of visitor and record the visitor.  Now it does it sometimes and others not.  Ring tech told me that if visitor has wi-fi or bluetooth active on phone, visitor is invisible to camera.  Think about that when you decide if you can trust it.
title: Cellphone can make its user invisible to this phone

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Charles
content: It is not a bad product, but it could use some upgrades. When putting it on the lowest setting for motion (5 feet) the mailman triggers it. But by the time it starts recording, the mailman is already down the stairs. On the same setting, it will trigger certain times of the day when a vehicle drives by. The road from the device is 55 feet away. Optical illusion for the sensor maybe? The audio is not really good, it sounds like a digital break up when standing about 5 feet away, when standing near the foot of the steps, about 15 feet, can't hear anything in a normal talking voice. We have an internet extender right on the other side of the wall, it doesn't help. The battery life is ok, just depends on how long you watch the Live Video or how many times it gets activated. About every 2 weeks I charge it. Overall, I think this is a decent buy, I am sure there are better ones out there, it is good enough to pay for the subscription for a year.
title: Not terrible, but not bad

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Christian in Florida
content: UPDATE: The problem I mentioned below that earned this ring doorbell one star has been completely rectified. I have to say that ring customer support was the absolute best. They helped me troubleshoot my phone without making me feel like an idiot and ultimately determined that the problem had already been fixed through an update that was automatically downloaded to my phone only a few days after I left a negative review. Needless to say, my ring doorbell is working perfectly. The ring doorbell gets five stars and yes, I recommend it and would buy one again. Thank you Ring! Pros: good video, wide field of view, good motion sensing and detection Cons: known problems with Galaxy S10, possibly some other Samsung products, makes the sound on this doorbell unusable. First, let me say this is not my first ring video doorbell. I've had the ring doorbell in the past and it has worked flawlessly. Video has always been good and the sound, even the two-way communication, has always been good as well. However, this time, there was a problem. it seems after the doorbell was installed and everything was set up to include the app, when someone would ring the doorbell, I would not be able to hear them through the app on my Samsung Galaxy s10. They could hear me fine but I just could not hear them and therefore could not communicate. I spent a great amount of time researching this on the internet and apparently there's an issue between the ring doorbell and the Samsung Galaxy phone and apparently Samsung thinks ring should fix it and ring thinks Samsung should fix it. And where does that leave the customer? You guessed it, stuck in the middle. I attempted to fix that I found on the internet with adjusting settings in the Ring app as well as reinstalling ring. No luck whatsoever. If I ever get another video doorbell, I will check out all the others on the market. There are quite a few and several are actually rated higher than the ring video doorbell. As for me, I guess I will just use this one the way it sits and maybe one day when a different brand of video doorbell goes on sale, I will replace this. It's too bad. I kind of feel like I wasted my money.
title: It's working perfectly!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: LISA LCSW
content: The video is nice- it’s clear and good image.  At night, the image is good, too. I do have night lights out there, too.  Set up was easy and the app seems to work well. The problem...motion detection.  I live in Florida, so everything is flat, there isn’t an issue with sight line, but I can walk by the doorbell, up to the doorbell and after standing in front of it for about 10 seconds it will notice me. It will notice the delivery people about the time they are getting back to their truck.  I have gone into the app and the settings repeatedly and can’t get it any better. ************UPDATE************* Ring read my initial review (above) and contacted me to help me out.  IMPRESSIVE!!  Let me share some of the things I learned about the settings.  The setting capturing frequency- if it’s set to conserve battery life, it will only capture motion around every 10-15 minutes regardless of being in front of the door.  It will of course be responsive to a ring.  I changed that setting to ‘frequent’ and what a difference!  It uses battery life faster, but it captures all motion. But then I was getting captures from every car going by, even though the street is about 60 feet away, so Ring sent a wedge so I could angle it down a little (Florida being so flat, there is little visual distinction for the camera). So, thank you Max, from RING, for being so helpful. I can’t say enough about customer service!  And I really, REALLY, like my Ring Doorbell now!  So much so that I am going to get my Mom one for a gift!  I might get one for the side door, too. ******another update**** I take responsibility for not understanding the service plan- but..... I’m shocked at how scaled back the doorbell is without the monthly subscription plan!  The description stated “subscription needed for advance functions...(sic) like share and save for 60 days”. So I thought- I have no desire to share videos and don’t need to save video beyond a few hours if anything comes up while I’m at work.  Well, I was wrong! You get bubkis. You still get notified if the video is triggered, but by the time the app boots up the person is long gone. You have the ability to look through the camera live, and if someone rings the doorbell if you answer it that moment, you can see them and speak with them.  But no reviewing the video, not even one minute.  I feel I already paid a lot for the doorbell, that paying every month is prohibitive for me.  I will likely move this elsewhere in my home, maybe somewhere I can check in on the dogs, and get a doorbell that has an SD card.  I love the concept of the video doorbell, but will find a different option for me and my mom.
title: Not so great-at first- but Ring helped

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Libby Sumner
content: Our dislikes was trying to set the distance on video properly. The video only picks up after someone is already at the door. It does not pick up Anyone approaching across the yard or drive leading up to the porch. Spoke to someone on the phone Saturday a week ago, she was to call following Sunday but I ended up having to call back myself. Spoke to another representative figured that we needed a wedge kit to adjust the camera and proceeded to gather information in order to get the wedge kit, she said hopefully about 2-3 days. Well one week later we received a package from Ring and enclosed was the charger cord which actually came in with the original delivery. So now we still have No Wedge Kit. Was also informed that there would be charges for this as I had asked for something with all the trouble we’re having to get our Ring to do the job it’s supposed to do.
title: Please send us a Wedge Kit as soon as possible and at No Charge. Thank you

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kleinsak
content: Great video quality compared to the original.  There are a couple of things I don't care for, like how the mounting plate is configured differently than the original and if you hardwire it, it has to be wired directly to the doorbell instead of the plate.  The problem this creates is when you screw the hardwired electrical wires you are forced to pull extra out and then when you mount it there's no place for them to go.  The other thing that I find frustrating is unlike in the original you cannot control the distance for the motion zones.  I have the original and this one on the original I can physically adjust the zones well viewing the live view, on this version you just get an option to enable or disable zones from a live view and then a basic screen to "adjust the slider so your motion zones avoid the street" but it doesn't show you how far the zones go out you just have to guess.
title: Great video, wish it had some of the same features of the original.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Dee
content: This looks very awkward on siding. I wish they had mentioned the adjuster product before I bought this. This product is bigger than I thought. I can see it at my mailbox which is about 50 yards (for all you football lovers) away from my front door. The view is great, but only when it works. I have to wait for the app to connect before using the view or talk feature and sometimes that is too late. It does not pick up any activity from its side view. I have had people pull into my driveway and nothing. I have had UPS drop off packages on my porch and nothing. You can clearly see my driveway and porch from the device. Other than that, I can check in (almost) anytime I want. It is nice for the sense of security it gives. You do have to pay a subscription to keep some of the perks. I do want to purchase a second to put on the side of my house.
title: Missing some of the action

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: sleepjunky
content: Be careful - the battery does not come out but is built into the device! It is my fault for not reading more carefully, but honestly, what a poor design to have the battery inside instead of a removable battery! Also, the coloring is misleading in this photo. Buy the kind with the removable battery - I already had one of those and it’s the one you want.
title: Poor Battery Design

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: David Kopf
content: I have this ring doorbell and the floodlight cam. The floodlight cam and generally their customer service is very good. This doorbell is not because it doesn’t detect motion or runs out of battery, even when hardwired. Explained: Although mine is hardwired, it runs out of battery when I set the motion frequency to high, which I had to do because standard mode has a rule where when it detects and records, it will not do so again for some period of time. The practical implication of leaving it on standard mode was that at least twice, it did not detect someone right in front of the door. Probably happened a lot more but I happened to see those two instances. If I want to solve this problem, I set the frequency to high...but then it runs out of batteries. So no, I wouldn’t buy this again and would not recommend to anyone. Maybe their newer models don’t have this flaw... Update: I changed my motion frequency to light (least battery intensive mode). It has been 3 days and the battery is only 53%. :(
title: Runs out of battery when hardwired

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jennifer
content: I wanted so desperately to like the Ring products. I bought 3 of the 2020 updated 1080p HD doorbells because I heard nothing but good word of mouth reviews. Money wasted and can’t return now. First off motion detection worked great for the first week then all of sudden I’m getting missing footage and motion detection stopped. Not on one but ALL 3. You have to be right up on the doorbell now for it to trigger. All 3 have the latest firmware update since it makes you update when you first set them up. I’ve tried resetting the motion zones and adjusting settings, and rebooting the WiFi and modem and nothing.  Still issues. Only thing I haven’t tried yet is resetting the entire unit again but I shouldn’t have to do that with all 3 of them like this. Night vision is pretty dang clear and much better than the spotlight cam for sure so no issues there. WiFi connect is ridiculous. My router sits on the same wall one of the doorbells is installed at and is only 3 ft from it and still can’t get better than RSSI -57 and when looking in the router UI it’s -59 Dbm.  The video is laggy as well. Same issue with the other 3 too. Never will I purchase Ring products again and I should have read all the reviews as well as the ring forums as I’m not the only one having these issues. Once the installment plan is paid out I’m going back to SmartThings and getting real cameras that actually work properly. Oh and the customer service is ridiculous. Not once but twice dealt with a support rep with an attitude problem. That is the worst thing you can have when a customer is already calling in upset.
title: Piece of junk

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: nhinz
content: In-app option for continuous recording not available. In app control for length of recording not available. I should be able to record before and after an event. I should also be able to say record for an duration of my choice for specific events. I’m still in the free 30 days, but if I have to pay for these limited in app options I will return. It seems like the intent of ring is to lock the user into paying a monthly fee; unfortunately the service for this fee is seriously lacking.  The app is not intuitive at all. The tutorials garbage.
title: No control of recording durations. Useless

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: C. Silver
content: 1st of all, this was my 3rd Ring purchase.  I have been happy with the previous devices and thought they were a great value, so I decided to expand my security to the back door and buy another Ring device.  This one (an 'all-new', 'improved' 2nd generation) is very different. I could not get the mounting plate off, and re-read all the little pamphlets that came with it 3 times to find out how.  There are NO instructions to remove the mounting bracket!  Not wanting to damage the device by doing it wrong, I went online, and, after searching Youtube and other websites, found out how to remove the mounting bracket (it's simple, but RING NEEDS TO INCLUDE THAT INFO with the device!). Then, I got the bracket hung outside and went to setup my device.  Remember, I already have 2 other Ring devices.  I went to my Ring app on my Android phone, and could not find 'set up a new device' like the instructions said.  After searching, I found the set up and made more than a dozen attempts to set up this new device.  FINALLY, after much frustration, it completed the setup.  (hint: don't use the stupid scan thing on the back of the Ring; instead type in the 5 number code!). After setting it up, I took it out and installed it on the bracket (the ONLY easy step in this process!). Then I pushed the Ring button to test it, heard the 'doorbell' ring, but got nothing on my phone. The phone said 'failed to connect, and had a blue reconnect button.  Since then, and after much searching on the internet, I have tried to 'activate' or 'reconnect' the device more times that I have counted, and still nothing!  My conclusion: this new gen 2 device is a piece of crap.  My only hope at this time is if amazon will replace it, or refund my (Amazon day) sale price.  If only Ring could be made to reimburse me for my time: I started before noon and it is now 4:30 PM!  DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME and money on this useless device.
title: Instructions are lacking! It took over 4 hours to set up and install and it still won't work!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mrs. Robinson
content: We bought this latest (this is our 3rd) Video Doorbell because we bought a new house and left our old one for the person buying our house.  I wouldn't be without one.  We have one at our primary residence and now our second home.  If you are away a lot, or in our case, a second home, this doorbell is almost required.  Anyone that walks up to your door, be it the Amazon delivery person or someone casing your house, you will see them CLEARLY.  And you can even talk to them if you want to.  The app on your phone alerts you when someone has approached, and it records it.  When you're several hundred miles away, this is invaluable.  The ads you see about these doorbells?  They happen every day.
title: Wouldn't Be Without One

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Amazon Customer
content: ***UPDATED 08/18/2020*** After leaving my original review, I promptly received a contact from a Ring Community Support Representative. The representative was very professional, polite and knowledgeable. He was able to address most of my issues, which I will address. But I want to address the connection problem first. -You should know the recommended minimum requirements, which at the time of my purchase were not listed. This would have saved me a lot of time, troubleshooting, frustration and money. It is recommended your Wi-Fi internet connection have 2 MB/s download and 2 MB/s upload speeds. The way to check is using your cell phone search the internet for an internet speed test. Go outside where you’d like to connect the Ring camera and run the test. If you do not meet the minimum requirements, you may experience similar connection problems. I have over 30 MB/s download but 1.90 MB/s upload speeds. This is the fastest speed from my provider in my area. I experienced long wait times for the camera to load, camera cutting out and connection error messages. I thought I had good internet speed because I can telework from home and stream video content with no issues, but apparently my internet is not fast enough for the camera.  Ring support kindly offered a refund. The installation process does not seem difficult, but I personally cannot install or uninstall the camera. I had to pay someone to install the camera and will likely need to pay someone to uninstall the camera. This sucks because I needed the camera for safety purposes. ISSUES RESOLVED: -The rep was knowledgeable in troubleshooting the following issues. In the Ring app setting you can select to have a live view option in the dashboard. Even better, ther is the Rapid Ring app. This app only shows your cameras with a one touch button for live view. This app is great if you miss the notification, or quickly want to see your cameras and live view. There was also less connection issues with the Rapid Ring app. -You can link and answer your Ring camera with your echo device. Uninstalling and reinstalling the twice fixed the connection problem I was experiencing. -The rep adjusted my camera’s sensitivity and other tweaks to my liking. Amazon listing the minimum requirements would have saved me a lot of trouble. I do not know why this was not listed. As mentioned, the Ring Community Support rep was excellent, and I appreciated his effort. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- No problem with picture quality or night vision. Too many bugs with the camera and app. I constantly receive the activating device notice when going into live mode. I have good Internet and the camera is about 8 feet from the router so there should be no connection problems. P If I miss a notification for answering the door and have to tap into the app there are several taps  to get to live view. Why isn't there a live view button on the dashboard? Also, the Alexa skill does not work. I will get a notification on my Dot stating there's a person at the front door. When I say Alexa answer the front door it does nothing. I may send the camera back and look at other options.
title: What you need to know

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Heidi
content: Person detection only doesn’t work. Detects every car that drives by. Live video works only sometimes. Car was broken into and devise didn’t detect nothing or capture any video but captured every other stupid thing before and after incident. My family isn’t safe at all. Ridiculous. I expected way better from this product.
title: Garbage

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: roymac
content: Don’t get involved with ring, I have no experience with other systems, but I think it would hard to be worse in the long run.  I now own 2 door bells, a spotlight camera and a chime. Each time I buy, it’s because I already own equipment and want to keep everything uniform, but regret each purchase. Not a single ring item I have owned has set up on the first try, I’m pretty average on tech in 2020 but it just isn’t as easy as it should be, and tech support by phone is sub par. Expect an hour of setup up time the first time as you wait on the phone, if you can get through. After you own some equipment expect an hour setup for new equipment as you update your app and  each piece of equipment., seriously, I own two properties and spent most of my time with my hand on my forehead. After your equipment is set up and working, get ready for the real let down. Imagine you are at work, you get an alert that your doorbell has been pressed, you respond to the alert, 30 seconds later after watching a wheel spin you get to view nobody there. They left, long gone, but that’s how long it takes. Furthermore, since you responded to the promp, it doesn’t start recording until you can see it live. And it takes at least 30-60 sec for it to see live. So someone has pressed your doorbell, it takes 30-60 sec for the ring doorbell to establish a connection, if they haven’t already left  already, that’s a long time waiting staring at you phone, they gave up and walked away. When you check your recorded events (at a monthly subscription price), all you get is the “live video recording” but since it took up to a minute  to connect ( if it does, many times it won’t) they have left and all you have is a recording of absolutely nothing. Also, video recording is for only 14 seconds for motion alerts. So someone comes up to your driveway or front yard and scopes out you property for a bit. Then they wreck, vandalize, steal or whatever to your property. It won’t be filmed ! Let me say that again, 14 seconds of recording that you pay for, per motion alert. And my spotlight has been connected for 2+ years, it sucks, I can rarely get a live view to work in  my own home. It suddenly disconnected from my home network, looking forward to spending an hour plus getting a previously working piece of equipment to work. Don’t do it UPDATE 7/22/20 After having this for a while, some additional observations: -hardwiring this device solves none of the issues I mentioned above, but I guess I don’t Have to remove it to charge it now. -it takes a few seconds for this to start recording in 1080. It starts recording well after someone enters the activity zone , so they are usually pretty close by the time it wakes up. For a few seconds it records at a very low resolution, somewhere around a 7 year olds sketch and recording with VHS. Expect most recordings to have low resolution when it would help identifying them, and by the time 1080 finally sets in, they have moved out of frame. -After 30 days you have to pay for recording service, the app will tell you that you need to subscribe, but will not provide a link in the app to allow you to Sign up, also you can’t sign up within the app. You have to go to the website log in and do that. Have fun searching around the app for a while, only to realize you can’t sign up for the service using the interface that you use 99.999% of the time
title: Noooooooooo.....then I went back and updated my review, still nooooooooo

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Lazaro
content: This horrible doorbell can't seem to keep a wifi connection for more than a few hours. When I first got it it worked fine for the first couple of days but then one day I woke up and noticed that the doorbell hadn't recorded anything. I tried going in to live view and it didn't connect. So, I removed the doorbell, pressed the orange button on the back and reset its wifi connection. That worked for about another day and then the same thing happened. I didn't want to remove the doorbell again so I just unplugged my modem/router in hopes that everything would reset and the doorbell would pick up the connection again. It worked! For like half a day.... By nighttime the connection was lost again. So I went in to my wireless router settings and I looked around and noticed it did show the ring doorbell as being connected to the wifi but for some reason the live video still wouldn't transmit and I would get no motion alerts. So the doorbell is connected to the wifi but it is not transmitting. Still, I decided to log in to my router and mess around with the settings to see if that would help. I did a little research, changed the wifi channel etc. The doorbell would always reconnect and work fine but after a few hours it would stop working again. It just doesn't transmit anything despite it showing up as being connected to the wifi. Now, I will say I am no expert in wifi connections or routers or anything like that but I've tried my best to troubleshoot the problems. I stood outside with my phone right next to the doorbell and ran the internet speed test from the Ring App. With the door closed and everything. As if my phone was the actual ring doorbell. As you can see I uploaded the pictures of the results and it is sufficiently fast for the Ring to work. So the wifi signal outside does not seem to be the problem. I mean, the router is literally along the same wall running parallel to the doorbell just about 20 feet away. I do live in a Condo so maybe once in a while someone turns something on that disrupts the signal... I don't know. But still, you would expect the damn doorbell to attempt to reconnect by itself without me having to reset the router or having to unscrew my doorbell and press a button once a day. It is awful, just awful! Biggest headache ever. Plus the ring app itself isn't very helpful. When I go into "device health" in the app in order to get the latest up to date information about my device I first have to first connect the live view, then I have to go into "Device Health Report" and then finally the information displayed will refresh. I don't think the information being displayed is even accurate to be honest with you. I'm very disappointed in the Ring doorbell. I'm not even sure what the return policy is on this doorbell is but I swear if it weren't for the fact that I will be left with 4 horrible holes on the wall outside my condo unit (and I have no matching paint to cover and paint over the holes) I would have removed this doorbell and tried to return it. It's JUNK! At least my old wired doorbell chime still rings when someone presses the Ring button but this thing has turned out to be the biggest, most expensive doorbell button ever. 7/31/20 Update So, a Ring representative reached out to me a few weeks ago to try and help me fix the connection problems with my doorbell. I purchased a WiFi range extender and although it did help with the doorbell keeping a WiFi connection I still had some intermittent connection problems where some motions were missed and I couldn’t connect to Live View. Most of the connection problems seemed to happen during the weekend so I’m assuming it was caused by neighbors being home and using electronics that interfered with the WiFi signal or something like that. After explaining all this to the Ring representative they were nice enough to send me a Chime Pro which I installed in the same spot as the WiFi extender I had before. I haven’t had any more connection problems after installing the Chime Pro. It’s been about two weeks now and the RSSI level for both the Doorbell and the Chime stay at around -55 most of the time. I gotta say that Ring customer service has been excellent. They really want to keep customers happy and get their products working as intended. Still, I honestly can’t give the doorbell more than four stars because even though I got it working it did take a lot of trial and error and it does require buying extra stuff to get it working right. Plus the doorbell is not perfect since the video and audio are still choppy at times. It’s not a deal breaker for me because at least the doorbell does capture everyone that comes to my door, which is what I wanted, but it doesn’t work as smoothly as advertised. As long as you’re aware of all these issue though, I think the doorbell is a decent product. I just wish Ring were more “honest” in their advertising and showing the way the doorbell video might actually look and sound if your WiFi connection isn’t perfect. Plus they should also probably warn people that they will most likely need to buy a Chime to keep a solid WiFi connection with the doorbell. I don’t know why they don’t just sell it as a bundle doorbell/chime and that way they can avoid some of these connection problem issues.
title: Biggest piece of junk ever? Update.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: OU Blind Dude
content: This thing was a 2 hour fiasco to set up. Customer service said they were having lots of problems w the gen 2. Works okay. It starts recording way too late. The person can be out of the video by the time it starts recording. Seriously.  Delivery guy triggers it but can be gone on the video it takes. Apparently u have to buy the Ring V Dbell 3 plus. Which is 229.00 on sale. It records 4 seconds before. Why can't the thing just start recording immediately when it's triggered? It starts recording 3 or 5 seconds after it's triggered. Pretty dissatisfied & disappointed in a big co like Ring & owned by Amazon. The motion detection notifications are half the time immediately &  the other half 30 to 60 seconds after. Even had a few that were 3 to 5 minutes later. UPDATE: I took 2 stars off. The motion detection & alerts are just pitiful.
title: Starts recording way too long after the motion is triggered.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: D. Martin
content: The doorbell was pretty easy to install. Video quality is very good. I am extremely annoyed that it does not always alert my phone when someone rings the doorbell. I've had to go in more than once and try to figure out the settings to get it to work, and it will work for a while then it will stop giving me notifications again. It's set to notify me in all modes, and the app is set to notify me in my phone, so it's very aggravating. I may return it if this keeps up because what's the point of having the device if it doesn't notify your phone that someone is at your door? Edit: it gets worse and worse. Even when someone rings my doorbelland I get a notification that someone's at the door, I don't get a visual when I tap into ring. In fact, the video of the motion sometimes doesn't even show up until much later. Today the doorbell was rung at 5:32, I couldn't see who was there and I couldn't get to the door, and when I tried to look back at the video recording it's stopped at 5:28 and did it go any further. It's a piece of garbage.  Seriously sorry I purchased this. Update 8/25: Like others, after owning this one month it stopped giving me any notifications at all.  Still records video,but I longer notifies me that someone is at my door.
title: DO NOT BUY!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
content: Buyer beware;  re: the new Gen 2 video door bell. It's a throwaway. While the description does mention it comes w a built in rechargeable battery, it fails to mention this bit: this was Rings answer to query To clarify, the Ring Video Doorbell 2nd Generation has a built-in battery that is not removable. It is not designed to be removed at any time. Opening the device will break your warranty. Subject to interpretation, doesn't mention anywhere battery can't be replaced. Deliberate Omission? So Amazon; (Quote but it fits} I'm not upset that you lied to me, I'm upset that from now on I can't believe you.
title: Cannot replace the rechargeable battery

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: STEVEN J ROTH
content: I just purchased them and then when found not working after reading all their info on line( why don’t they give phone numbers any more or make so hard to find ) finally spoke with tech who said that I’d more than 30 ft from router might not work. Wow nice to know and that for more money I can purchase a booster and that should fix the problem. Only reason I’m doing this is I’ll send them both back if not working . Why don’t they tell us this in the first place . Wasted 2 days and why don’t companies today give a phone number to talk to a human being in this country you can speak to for asssitance ? Look here on amazon and try and find numbers to get help not on bill or payment . I keep hearing we have become a service oriented country no longer manufacturing . Well where is the serivce ? Going on line to get info for non tech savvy people is not service
title: Warning must be installed close to router or might not work

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jessica Sexton
content: Don't waste your money this product is awful. It doesn't catch motion of a human until someone is right up on it and then it's too late for the image to be usefulvacated it will catch their ear as they walk by.  The mail man it will catch pull up but vacated ur takes him a second to get out the car or stops recording veggie he can get to it and it catches every single car that goes by my house no matter how I change the settings and detection around. It is literal garbage in ever way and not useful for any application. The notification it seems to my phone is also delayed and it is getting good signal from our internet. It takes all day to recharge it as well.  This was a total waste of money!
title: Total garbage!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: E. M.
content: I have just upgraded my 1st generation Ring Doorbell with this new 2nd Generation Ring Doorbell. PROS: 1) The same mounting plate dimensions/holes as the 1st generation I could install it to the same 3rd party wedge mount which I got for the 1st generation saving me $20 to buy a new one. 2) Better video quality: The 1080p video is noticeably better than the 1st generation's 720p . 3) Better connectivity: The 2nd generation seems to connect better.  When I ask Alexa to display the video on Echo Show, it sometimes took forever with 1st generation.  The 2nd generation seems to connect more reliably. 4) Motion sensor: I have not tested this just yet but I am sure it is better with the new zone setting and else. CONS: 1) Trade-in discount did not apply: When I ordered it,  it asked if I wanted to trade the old one by showing "Upgrade and save by trade-in" right above "Add to cart" right on the product page.  I proceeded to take advantage of it.  My request was accepted and received email confirming $10 credit for the old one and 20% discount on the new one.  Great I thought and I went back to the product page, added the item in the cart, and proceeded to place the order.  However, I could not see the 20% discount applied to the item, while I did get the $10 credit. I ended up calling Amazon and got the courtesy credit worth the 20%, but it was just lame. Why do they ask you to trade in when it does not work for the product? 2) Lower quality mounting hardware: The 1st generation came with a quick connect so it was a little easier to connect wires if you go with hardwired installation.  However, once the installation is done, it is no issue because you never take the doorbell off unless you live in some cold area like some reviewers here and still need to remove it to charge. If that's the case, I recommend you using a connector like the one in the picture I attached.  If you just go with the battery only installation, I do not see much difference.  You remove two screws and remove the whole doorbell to charge.  Personally, I would not choose this model if I were planning without hardwired connection. Overall, I am happy with the upgrade.
title: Improvement over the 1st generation

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Tim
content: Still no help with fraudulent monthly charge...amazon denies responsibility, again.  Ring people and support is evasive or non existent.  Just be aware once you buy it, your on your own and the system is buggy.  Now i have to call the bank to  deal with the issue.  Amazon plays dumb as money gets sifted out of your account with no service rendered.  Ring worked awesome for a few months...but i've been fighting with this camera since day one.  Tired of supporting this company.  Good luck!
title: Amazon bought ring, now it is buggy AND lack of customer support.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: June J.
content: I received this last week and just yesterday downloaded the app and set up the doorbell.  No problems at all.  Everything seems to be working.  I live in a mobile home with aluminum siding so I haven't put it on the wall yet.  As I'm an 80-year-old, I'm waiting for my son to come over.  He will make an opening in the aluminum and install the doorbell over it so that a good signal will get to my router, about 10 feet from where the doorbell will go.  Gave it 4 stars because not yet installed on the wall.  Will update the rating and review if necessary.  So far so good.  Thinking about hard wiring it - we'll see.
title: My first Ring doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Hunnybunny
