content: I had bought this 2nd gen ring because I thought it would have similar perks like the ring 2 (because I really wanted a ring 2). This 2nd gen doesn't have a detachable battery to charge (have to take off the whole system to charge), the mounting is not as secure as the ring 2, and also, the official ring website states that a new ring system will have a free month trial of video recording...my trial for this 2nd gen is ONLY 1 WEEK! I kinda felt like I got screwed but, for the price and the video quality of the system...I only got kinda screwed. But get the Ring 2 instead because in the long run, the perks are way better! Plus, you will definitely get 1 month free trial of basic video recording with the ring 2 per my friend! If I had done this all over again, I would choose a ring 2 which is now $167 @ Lowe's.
title: Get a Ring 2 instead

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Randy Saunders
content: Got the Ring Doorbell installed today.  Went through the setup wizard, and noticed you have to be right next to the thing to get a detection.  Went through the settings, I have AC power to the device so I turned off all the "battery conserving" features and moves sensitivity to the max.  You still have to be 4 feet from it for it to detect you.  This is exactly what a Porch Pirate would want in a security camera. Went to the community, and found a sad, long chain of disappointed users.  I'll update this review if any of them can figure it out.  Oh, yes, and I contacted Ring directly for assistance.  This is their reply, verbatim: Unfortunately, device troubleshooting and first time setup are temporarily unavailable in Chat. For self-help content, visit: support.ring.com For product news and neighbor message boards, visit: community.ring.com
title: Motion detection doesn't work.  Plus no customer support

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mrsk
content: Don't buy this product and go for a newer one or a different brand. I bought into the hype and the brand of the RING doorbell camera. This one would not pick up motion when someone is by the door. the ring app would load non stop as well constantly giving me error messages. When someone would ring the door bell, I rarely could get the app to show me the live screen. The battery wasn't much of a deal breaker for me but, it does pose a problem if you are picky about that aspect. about every week or two depending on usage it needs to be recharged. waste of money.
title: crap doorbell camera system

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Paul Pierron
content: Even with an exceptional WiFi setup and RSSI signal strength, and even with the device next to the router, it is so slow to send video anyone at the door would have left by the time it activates a live view. The sound from the unit to your tablet or phone is very weak and can barely be heard and the sound on the unit is super loud to the point of annoying all your neighbors.... meaning you can barely hear anyone speaking into it and anything you say is so loud it becomes distorted... even with all the settings set up correctly. Now perhaps if you have it constantly on and monitoring it would be more responsive or with motion sensing it would turn on the camera before the doorbell is actually rung, but if you are thinking of using it just for a doorbell and to monitor the video only when the doorbell rings, forget about it, you have to have it set up to sense motion and start the camera about a minute before the doorbell is pressed to get doorbell live of someone right when they are ringing the bell, which doing so would drain your battery. For a product targeting home owners, The only way for something like this to really work fast is to have it hardwired with Ethernet PoE, which i am surprise they do not offer this on all the units, it provides power to the unit and then provides potential gigabit ethernet using the ethernet cable instead of transformer wiring which you would route next to and then come up to your router. the other thing is it in not live at all, what it does is sends the video it captures to a server and then you watch that as it streams to you, which makes it a bandwidth hog - and any tech at ring, or anyone that hacks or buys their way to your privacy, and activate your camera, watch you or your saved videos, and you would not know it unless you check your router logs, but they can look at your videos at anytime and you would not know it.
title: So slow it is almost useless except as a basic WiFi ding-dong doorbell.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jen K
content: We cannot see our driveway from inside the house so this thing is a life saver! I don't know why we waited so long to get one. I love the color also. The only con is that it is a little laggy, when I am getting a package delivered or someone comes to the door by the time I get the alert they are already pulling out or are already to the door. I wish it would alert as soon as the "Ring" sees the motion. Other than that the picture quality is great day and night, and it was easy to install. Me and my husband have the app on our phone as well as both of our kids. I like that we can talk through it also.
title: Love this thing!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Karas
content: By far the best purchase I’ve made on amazon in a long long time and believe me I shop on here daily. We have a door that you can’t really see who is coming at the front of the house and initially I wanted this so that I could see who is knocking or ringing the doorbell. (And this device definitely does that it alerts you when there is a visitor at your door and you can have a contactless conversation with them in real time) Sooo... also being a smart mother with teenagers I wanted some thing that would capture our teenagers movements. ( you know keep/force  them to be honest). Yes you heard me! I have kids that like to think that they are sneaky and that mom and dad do not know. Upon hooking up the ring doorbell device we have learned that we will be now purchasing two of the flood light ring devices for our back doors, as the teenagers have decided to try to sneak out the back of the house after bedtime. The ring doorbell device and it’s recording capabilities are great I’m able to see people who come up to the door as well as when kids leave for school on time… Or try to sneak out after bedtime. The real time alerts assist me in answering the door and grounding the kids properly. This is one of the best devices that we have in our home, I mean, I thought the Rumba was great because it cut down on me yelling for someone to please sweep the floor. BUT the door bell alerts me immediately when someone is coming or going. I’m very happy to say that ring has forced my teens to bond with one and other...yes I know it has become my teenagers number one enemy. Instead of being mad at each other for snitching... they are collectively mad at the ring for existing. It is literally helping us parent by teaching my teenagers a lesson instantly consequences for their actions  that I hope they take with them when they have children. I am extremely happy with this doorbell and will be purchasing Two (maybe 3) floodlights with cameras for the back exits soon.
title: Parents love, kids despise

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: KHarma54
content: This is my second ring purchase and to start the doorbell wouldn't activate. It took 4+ hours to cycle through the activation process (my first doorbell connected in under 20). I called customer service and after a painful 56 minutes,Melvin picked up. You could clearly tell he had no interest in helping me and shuffled me off the phone, telling me that the device needed to fully charge. I asked what time their offices close and he had no idea, makes me wonder what kind of customer service they would provide during normal hours. (My call was at 8:15pm eastern time) this is enough for me to consider returning the first doorbell and the 2 chimes I bought and actually picking up a reputable company. All in all the video isn't very clear and the motion alerts do not always pick up even though I have the first doorbell set at the highest sensitivity. It has a pretty long delay (around 5-7 seconds) before the alert that there is motion notifies me. Often I end up catching FedEx or UPS drivers as they are getting back into their vehicle. If you are looking for a camera that could identify a person's face if they are trespassing or stealing packages, id say this isn't the camera for you. You will get a fuzzy image and most likely it will be the back of the person due to the lag. And for those that would say its my WIFI connection - its not. I have to have the highest speed available (which I do) for work purposes.
title: don't recommend

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Joms
content: You call this HD camera? What a joke! It can't even resolve a license plate of my car 15 feet away. My other generic camera 1/3 the price is infinitely better and sharper and able to resolve the license plate even during nighttime.
title: Pathetic IQ - Not true HD

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: joe c
content: I had to return the first one I got because the back-up battery would not charge and the battery has to be charged for it to work properly. I received a second one and it worked fine.  But I'm not very happy with that one either. Pros: Great picture (picture is an actual picture from my Echo 8) and loud alert. Easy installation -- took me about 20 minutes to remove existing doorbell and install the Ring and setup software. Cons: Long delay between time motion is detected and alert sounds.  I can walk the 25 feet up my walkway to the door before the alert sounds.  I'm not sure what caused alert by the time motion is detected and alert sounds because nothing appears on my echo. So, it could have been a car or a false alert. Tech support says there is nothing that can be done about delay. Battery must be charged for it to work even when it is hardwired to doorbell.
title: Not very happy with it, but it works...

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kat C.
content: Initially, the price pulled me in, it’s the quality that deserves 5 Stars. I have a tree & bushes near my porch, yet the Ring isn’t fooled. I’ve only had a couple “Motion Detected” in 3 weeks - usually the garbage truck for some odd reason. I’m so impressed that I’ll be getting at least one more for the front of my house. Maybe an odd “selling point,” but I like having the option of “Community Alerts.” Knowing what other neighbors are experiencing, helps me be more vigilant and interactive with neighbors. Oh, and the Community Board is completely anonymous. I cannot beat the price for peace of mind. If you are on a budget - or just not interested in a major alarm company contract, get Ring. Oh, make sure your WiFi is strong. I’m getting a booster for my modem to speed up viewing recorded incidents as they happen. Live viewing is great - and I’ve not had any issues with rain interfering with recording.
title: Peace of mind for one hundred bucks drew me in

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Laura Jones
content: Doesnt work. Can not finish set up because it just keeps saying error. Also everytime I try to pull it up on my phone to look at it it just keeps searching and then fails.
title: Doesnt work

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: tbearsdaddy
content: I always was curious about Ring so I finally decided to try. Glad I did! This has really been a nice addition to our house. Picture is very clear. Picks up motion and people in the area. I haven't done it but I believe you can turn down the sensitivity on the motion if its too much for you. Mine picks up cars as they drive on the street and alerts me. Detects animals , cars, people and sometimes when its really windy, a tree my activate it. Overall, I feel good about this purchase and makes me feel a little safer. Easy to install. Comes with a few pieces you may need for installation.
title: Ring

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Chelsey C.
content: Motion detection is good however doesn’t record the entire experience. For example I got an alert saying there was motion, I pull up the footage and it shows a doe in my front yard eating my plants then the video stops. Doesn’t record for the entire time the deer was out there just a clip. The other day I had an alert of motion, checked the footage and a man pulled in my driveway, delivered a package to the door and the clip ended. I’d like to be able to see the entire motion events not just a clip of it. Does not continuously record. Only records movement. However pictures/videos and live stream are very good. Cute sleek design also and I like how it connects to my actual doorbell.
title: Great video but only shows clips not video in its entirety

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Anastasia
content: All of the features worked beautifully! That wasn't the problem for sending it back. Just be careful in selecting the correct one. This one is not the Second Generation. The Second Generation has more updates and features than the first one plus they are the same price. Also, watch out for the Ring feature if it needs to be Recharged every so often! I made this mistake too. There is the one that operates off your doorbell electrical wires so it doesn't need to be taken down for a recharge every 2-3 months! Now, I am off to buy my 3rd Ring Lol 😆  Please learn from my mistakes
title: NOT 2ND GEN PLEASE READ

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jule
content: Well we had to buy a wedge mount. Now it’s installed and it won’t make the chimes in the house ring. My phone is the only doorbell. Now that it’s up my dogs have no idea when someone is here. I have to buy a chime to plug in the wall to hear it in the house? WTF? The chimes that go with this thing have crappy reviews that you can’t hear them. I’m concerned because our house is a ranch style. You can be in the far end and not hear the doorbell we had! HELP! This thing is a pain in my ass! I am ready to send it back and get out my old doorbell and put up separate cameras for better views anyway! Smh!
title: Crap! Buy more ring stuff to make it work x4! Just get security!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Maggie L Bohannon
content: I am satisfied with our doorbell camera, but if anything, the motion detection could be better. This was our first RING purchase, so I am not familiar with how it compares to other varieties or generations. We have our Ring doorbell installed beside a set of stairs, and it seems that the handrails block just enough so that the camera does not really detect until someone is RIGHT in front of it. By the time the actual video is triggered, about half of the activity is actually missed before someone goes inside the front door. Luckily, we have now connected our RING doorbell to other smart lighting at the bottom of the stairs so that when the lighting is triggered, the doorbell will also turn on. This helps to improve capture, but it also causes unnecessary battery use on occasion. At the end of the day, I'd rather use up battery but still capture more video than potentially miss something. The video quality is good and night vision satisfactory. The camera and microphone work well. We ended up connecting our RING to an after market solar panel so that it maintains battery for a longer period of time. I am very satisfied with our purchase and would definitely recommend this product in the future.
title: Good doorbell camera, motion detection could be slightly better.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Conanton
content: I’ve had the ring doorbell for just about a month now and I’m actually a little bit disappointed as far as the timing between receiving the notifications and actually being able to open the app to see who’s at the front door. It takes several seconds and in that time someone can have come and gone. It’s not as seen on TV where you get the chime notification and it’s instantly  on your phone for viewing. But I do find that it is a good product and a three dollar monthly fee for saving videos is very affordable
title: Live view after notification a bit disappointing

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Tammy Campbell
content: I wish I hadn’t purchased this.  My understanding was that I was going to get a video doorbell that I could see who was at my door. My husband did a quick set up but after about 2.5 weeks the battery was dead.  But I did purchase the part to plug into the wall so you don’t have to constantly charge it.  When he had a few minutes he hooked it up the rest of the way.  So my problems are, since we set it up it doesn’t matter HOW we adjust the settings it goes off constantly with cars going past my house, I don’t live on a busy street per-say but busy enough to drive you batty with it going off every 3-5 minutes! So now that it’s set up correctly the battery says it won’t charge.  After 2 days now it still says it’s not charged..  BUT.. it is chiming telling me that their are cars going past.  Next problem.  The delay on this is anywhere from 5-20 seconds!  So now after the subscription trial is over with.. yes ANOTHER one of those pay me monthly schemes, it will go off, with cars, with deliveries, with neighbors who knows what BUT when you click on live it won’t open bc of something with the battery  and because of the delay And the subscription that is over with I can’t see the history, even tho it was like 30 seconds ago..  so basically this is completely useless for us!!!  Not a good purchase!!! **update**. The ring finally charged after day 4.  I do have a bit of a delay still but it will allow me to see what it is... I’m still not thrilled with having to pay monthly to be able to see the history of the videos, but it not as much as what I thought it would be... so I’m happy with the purchase now..
title: All’s good now...

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: N
content: My watch and phone always tell me when there’s someone at the door which I love! The only bummer (and I don’t know if it’s the ring or my internet) is that when I open the app to see who’s at my door, it says the ring is connecting and it has to prepare the video before I can see it. I like on the app that I can change the direction and spacing that the ring is recording so I don’t get a notification every time a car drives by.
title: Great for security, good app options

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Amber Bloom
content: I am very happy with this purchase! Always has a great signal and works with my Alexa devices.  When I enabled the Ring with Alexa, I was constantly receiving notifications in every room that "someone is at the door". VERY annoying, especially to the kids. I was able to disable motion alerts through the Ring Skill on the Alexa app. MUCH better now. I hardwired mine to the Chime already in my home. Works perfectly. It took me about 15 minutes to install one. The other is not wanting to connect to my wifi for some reason, but I am not afraid to troubleshoot. All in all, an OUTSTANDING device. Not sure why I waited so long to make this purchase.
title: Well worth the money for Peace of mind

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: bkwrm
content: This a second attempt to create an honest review for the Ring doorbell. I bought two in good faith. I didn't like them because the night vision was poor. There is also a monthly premium for viewing your videos and a forum that allows you to post events in your neighborhood that the moderators deem important. I manage4d to return one of them but the second I am stuck with because there is a deadline to return these items and as is often the case, I became distracted and missed the last day. Picture 1: "night vision" blurred by neighbors' security lights and Screen Grab from my remaining ring. a premium for viewing your videos along with a forum to post anything criminal in your neighborhood. Finally, there is good reasoning behind so many bad reviews and the follow-ups where Ring apologizes for the "experience"  customers are having. I hope this review encourages Amazon customers to fully research this product before buying it, making sure it is a good fit for their needs. So buyer beware unless you like forums, subscriptions, and clunky apps. I have had enough of those. :)
title: Buyer Beware unless......

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jearl
content: I've had the Ring Series 2 doorbell for one week now.  The setup and install were a breeze.  My old doorbell was wired so I don't need to worry about recharging the battery.  Though the setup I found the Ring will use my old chime box which is convenient.  I was also able to set the distance for motion detection so I would get notices for cars passing by or folks walking past my house, which is comment in my neighborhood.  I setup the Ring up with my Alexa so I get announcements too.  I also got the App for my Mac and can see videos and control the Ring from my computer as well as everyone in the home's cell phone.  Overall we love it and plan to purchase a few other Ring cameras.
title: Works Better Than Expected!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Stephen Sanders
content: 0 stars if it was possible. This doorbell only lasted 5 months. I had mine hardwired in with highly restricted motion sensing. One day it quit going to live video and accepting the charge from the hard wire. In app says 0% battery. So I removed the hard wires and charged it for 6 hours via usb. This did nothing. The front ring lights up as fully charged and resets itself constantly. Upon calling customer service I was directed to charge for another 6 hours and call back. They wouldn't listen to me when I said it won't accept the charge, shows a fully charged front ring, and that it won't perform a hard reset with the orange button in the back. Obviously a faulty battery or charge sensor. When I asked to speak to another representative I was put on hold forever to the point that I hung up, a tactic to keep dissatisfaction off the reps record. There was 0 wait time to talk to the first rep. Considering that you have to pay a subscription to save videos, this product is not worth the headache and continuous price tag. Not at all imo. Poor product full of software and firmware bugs, a battery that fails in cold weather (lithium polymer), completely fails before 6 months, and with horrific customer support that has zero knowledge of their product while also seemingly lacking integrity. I do not recommend. They need better programmers, better support, and better hardware.
title: Ridiculous amount of issues. Not recommended.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: zauzich
content: This Ring doorbell has amazing picture quality the night vision was startlingly good but when I hear someone outside and try to activate it, the wheel spins but nothing happens. I've waited almost five minutes to see if it activates and it doesn't. It's not too far from the wifi router, the wifi has sufficient bandwidth, etc. to handle the video, it just won't activate. I have to close the app and reopen it and sometimes it activates after that but sometimes it doesn't. If it doesn't work when I need it to work it's a $179 decoration (because I bought the solar charger too) where our doorbell used to be. I'm very disappointed, to say the least. UPDATE: Ring sent us a Chime Pro for free to extend the signal from our wifi router since neither could be moved but this has not improved the problem at all. The specs call for the Chime doorbell to be NO MORE than 15 feet from the router but THESE SPECS ARE NOT LISTED IN ANY OBVIOUS PLACE! I will not purchase another Ring product nor will I recommend Ring products to anyone else.
title: If it takes five minutes to activate then it really doesn't work

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mark Reuger
content: Definitely not what I expected.  The bronze color appears dirty.  My package was thrown together and when I opened it the papers were everywhere.  I hooked it up and the picture quality is blurry at best.  The sound transfer comes out mumbled.  The directions on the hookup were confusing and I ended up calling the help line.  Which was equally as confusing when I had to sit on hold for 30 minutes.  Motion detection works well and alerts my phone through the app.  You can also pay $10/month for the service which isn’t too bad.  Night vision isn’t horrible but I haven’t really seen anything worth while yet.
title: Service cost was low, app is interesting, voice transfer is weak

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Christina
content: I love being able to check my breezeway when I am away from home. It is good to know when my messages say a package has arrived I can see when it was delivered. It’s also great to see when people stop by. This was super easy to mount, I plan on getting the wedge to angle it more in the future. Battery life really depends on what your settings are in the app. Since I like to know everything I have it set up to notify for any motion, linked events Incase the alarm or other cameras go off. Even with the excess and being at a main door that we are in and out of constantly the battery lasted well.
title: Easy setup, good view, good battery life

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mark E. Swiatly
content: It took a couple of days to get the motion detection set up properly.  Even though the section that had my street in it was turned off for motion detection every single car that went by kept setting off the notification.  It wasn't until I change the setting that said my street was 15-30 feet away did it stop.  Even though the street is 40 feet away from my Ring doorbell.  Other than that it has been very good and I am very happy that I purchased.  I've seen other complain about the wi-fi but have not seen the problem.  My router is on the second floor a good 50 feet away from my router and has had no problems.  Also, had no problem hooking up to my Alexa Echoes and Fire tablets.
title: Difficult to set the motion detection settings at first.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Amy
content: The ring doorbell itself functions however be aware of how it functions. You do not get a direct feed from the doorbell. The door bell uses your wifi to send the video to the ring servers then you access the feed from their  servers. You have no direct link to the ring device. If the servers are laggy then you might see the video for 10 minutes( I timed it ). This is why the device is incredibly limited without their service which they charge for. Without their service you cant see what happened 10 seconds ago much less 2 minutes. If the ring servers go down and they do the device is a brick until they get them back up and nothing is recorded during this time. Just be informed the camera feed is not sent to you directly so you cant just use your own storage to capture the camera feed. Ring gets the feed from the camera then you can access it from them and this is your only option.
title: Be aware of the lag

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Chicken
content: With the climate of the world right now this doorbell offers the best support for my troubled mind when I am away from home. The video quality is amazing, night vision is perfect. We need to extend our WiFi to get better signal for talking to people at the door but for being in a place with such low WiFi it does amazing and I can see within a few seconds who is there. I’m so happy to have this, it’s nice to know I have a little more security at home.
title: I feel more safe now

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: M.
content: Inferior to Wyze and zmodo in many ways like it doesn't consistently connect live video where Wyze and zmodo very rarely have any issues further away from the AP. I'm pretty dissatisfied with that. There is also a longer delay for it to notify than other devices. The huge benefit and selling point is that it is a video doorbell, and that's JUST enough to justify the purchase. Edit: the hardware keeps failing and the app never notifies that the hardware is offline in fact it says that it's online when it's offline. this is a failure in the software of the application and the hardware of the device that is completely unacceptable and so I have returned this.
title: App and device totally unreliable

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Samantha Downing
content: Should have bought this sooner. Set up and synch took five minutes, can view front door on my phone, table, echo show. ability to join ring neighborhood groups, it gives you daily reports of activities/incidents/allows for people to post on things in the app in your neighborhood of stolen property. Really cool functions and settings. View is crystal clear, more than just a door bell, can set up for any motion activity notification. LOVE IT!!!!!
title: LOVE at first home security site! Quick set up, crystal clear view, and alexa enabled for use

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Harry Rainey Jr.
content: I recently purchased this RING doorbell for my front Security gate. It was easy to install after charging for 8 hours. I estimate the charge is good for 3 months. My mail slot is near the gate and the postman set off the motion. Later a garbage truck and UPS truck triggered motion. Pulled up setting and a range pattern came on, I turned off the street so it won’t set it off. If packages are delivered, my iPad & iPhone will give off a alert tone. Or if anyone comes to the gate. Night vision is excellent. Intruders will be warned that they will meet Jesus if they come any further. I am enrolled with RING NEIGHBORS keeping track of crime. I plan to order another one for the backdoor, more as a Security device.
title: RING DOORBELL, excellent Security device, easy install.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Dylan Lawrence
content: This doorbell worked great for about two weeks and then just totally failed. The first problem was that, even though it was wired into the doorbell power lines, it began to lose battery. This was after several days of charging and having power from these lines. Some googling revealed this problem has been occurring for over a year to many customers. After the doorbell lost almost all power, I brought it in to charge off the micro-usb cable. At this point, I had to re-pair the doorbell to the WiFi twice. It never actually really reconnected. After another day or two of seeing if it would charge off the house wires or connect to WiFi I gave up and returned it.
title: Cannot recommend this product at all.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Richard Grogan
content: Love the product. Not a problem at all. Install isnt as easy as it says it is. Everyone's homes are designed differently. The masonry bit they give you for concrete doesnt work very well. Had to use one of my bits. Then I come to find out that I have a metal bracket in the wall behind where the doorbell face plate is for my current doorbell. I cant drill it or need a professional to come do it because I cant use the screws for the 4 corners which the ring requires. My doorbell face plate has a bottom and top screw and the metal frame is what holds it there and nothing is behind that. May be able to do this myself but it isnt an easy job or I have to call someone to do it. I probably wouldnt have bought it if I knew it wouldve been this difficult.
title: Product itself is great. Install is not as easy as it says. Do more research before installing.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: jason claycomb
content: I was happy with the device at first but after having it for a few weeks someone was able to take three flower planters off of my front porch. After turning the settings up and buying a power adapter the battery was still dying quickly. I called ring support and they told me the power adapter is only a 10% trickle charge and with the settings jacked up its still going to use power faster than it charges. After getting off the phone with him and charging the device to full my camera only recorded black screens. Also it no longer stated that it was hard-lined. I hoped deleting the app and device and reinstalling and activating it again would solve things... Oh how I was wrong... At first it just wouldn't stay in the setup mode. Now it is constantly stuck repeating the follow the instructions on the ring app prompt. Every 10 seconds or so. FML. I just want to send it back at this point. PoS!!!
title: Not Happy

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: shane
content: so far it's great, the only bad thing is it doesn't pick up people 100% of the time. I guess no matter how good something is it still can't be perfect. it was very easy to use and put on the house. it seems to hold a charge well. you have to mess with the app to get it the way you want. you can configure it in many ways like to take a picture every hour which I don't through the night it has timers and all kinds of sensitivity settings
title: as expected

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Tam
content: Motion detection works just regular, not sensitive as settings. I set up it detects 15-30ft. away but the camera detects in about 10ft. Night vision function is enough to see at night in normal street lights condition. The camera of 2nd generation is much better than the 1st generation. However, I still like the viewing angle of the 1st gen, which is 180 degree viewing. Intructions of setting up in the app is easy to follow. It also has detect problem functions at the end of set up steps to make sure everything work fine, and compatible with manual doorbell. Setting up and hard wiring take about 30 minutes to complete.
title: Works well. Camera lens much better than 1st gen

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: BK
content: Installation is pretty simple, and the way they package it with a bit for installing anchors is good. We have a Netgear Orbi wireless mesh system, so our wireless coverage is excellent. Unfortunately, the Ring Doorbell seems to either not have local storage, or doesn't let you access it without a $3 per month subscription. Also, when it detects motion (and it does have a not insignificant amount of false positives), it takes quite a bit for the "video to process" before you can access the stream, making it useless for real time monitoring. We have a several Wyze cameras throughout the house, and they never have this issue, so I suspect that the processor used in the unit is insufficient. When this doorbell quits working, I will no longer be a Ring subscriber.
title: Slow processing time, requires a subscription to be useful

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Holden Wood
content: Motion detection is terrible, it alerts you 30 seconds after the fact. You rarely see what caused the trigger in the first place. I bought it because my neighbor refuses to keep his mongrel on his own property. I want it to alert me in time to shoot the dog and put an end to this. When it alerts me, I get maybe 2 or 3 seconds of video and by the time I get my pistol and get to the door, it's gone. WiFi is decent. And I like the versatility of the chime that came with it. My biggest complaint is no ability to turn it off when you have an outdoor event. I disable every possible option and it still records about 200 clips of people moving around in the yard. It's not likely I'll keep this junk! Save yourself some headaches. Pass on this crap.
title: Essentially worthless.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Charles Winters
content: This is a top notch camera. You get what you pay for!  The app is very easy to use.  You can quickly and easily see who is at the door no matter where you are.  I wish it was compatible with my DatoHome smart lock, but I was able to connect the two through Alexa and check the camera then unlock the door conveniently.  The picture quality is amazing, and it records even when you don’t answer so you can go back and see when someone was near your door or knocks on it.
title: You get what you pay for

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: JKM
content: Overall, I'm satisfied with Ring Doorbell and I'd like to share how I feel about it after using it for about a month. Followings are summary of pros and cons Pros 1. Detection of who's in front of the door: This is a really good feature because I get a quick notification about who's in front of the door. I can check it because of the recording. 2. Ring Community: I notice that there is a ring community and they post alerts which helps a lot. 3. Easy installation: This was really nice and easy. I am not good with installing things like this but it was relatively easy. Cons 1. (Sometimes) Lagging - Even though I am very happy with the detection, I notice that I get a notification after about 5~10 mins later. ex) I opened the door because of notification but the notification was about me coming to house about 10 minutes ago. 2. Indoor bell doesn't work 50% of the time - I installed the ring correctly and when I press the button, chime works but it fails to work about 50% of the time.. I don't use bell but it would be nice if it works like it should. 3. False Detection - Because I trust in front of door notification, I always check to see whenever I get notice. But sometimes there is no one. However, I'm pretty satisfied with the ring and the con is minor to me. But it may be crucial to someone.. (like 50% of time, door bell not ringing).
title: Pros & Cons

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Laura
content: I replaced a ring doorbell that was about 6 years old. This one was much easier to install than the original ring doorbell.  I did receive the doorbell with missing parts. There were no security screws or wires to lengthen my doorbell wires. I’m also having WiFi issues. Not sure if that’s me or the doorbell but I’ll get it strengthened out. Overall I think it’s worth the money.
title: Easy to install

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Av8rTrav
content: Other than the main huge problem here, this is a great product and works well. Big problem: even when hardwired, you can only trigger motion an unknown number of limited times before it drains the battery faster than it can charge. They told me my camera had recorded 50 motion recordings and was "way too many." I had it that way in case of any report of problems on my street, to review the time line for any vehicles that may be out of place, in case of any neighborhood problems. So basically Ring has come out on the back end saying you can't use this as a street monitor, and only as a porch monitor for foot traffic. I wish they would tell you this up front. Battery went down to 3% in 3 months, hardwired. Even at 12% it will not let you use live view. I initially had a 10va transformer and tried upgrading to a popular 30va transformer (also use a mechanical chime). Battery did not increase after 1 day. I had to charge it via USB charger, and now have limited my motion to porch/front walkway and removed street motion, and scaled back sensitivity and frequency. I also limited recording back to 30 seconds. Battery seems to be holding with 30va transformer. Past the return window so I'm stuck with it. In my opinion this is a useless product as it can only record a limited number of times even while hardwired. The fact that they don't tell you this up front is nefarious. You can use it as a street monitor but will have to charge it via USB every few months or sooner. I also used thin metal washers to try and get better wire contact, and sanded all the copper wire ends. No improvement in charging. I can remove the security screws, hang it by the wires, disconnect the transformer, charge it outside via USB, if dry weather, but that is a huge pain. If I had to do it over again, any Ring doorbell would be off the list as it appears they all have this problem,while other hardwired smart doorbells do not appear to have this charging problem. 3 stars. But for the camera itself, picture is very good, 2 way communication is great. Their customer support is friendly and helpful.
title: Battery limits potential even when hardwired, otherwise very good

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: thatCC_girl
content: Had to relocate amongst this awful pandemic and moved into a townhouse development. We wanted to keep a very close eye on our brand new leased vehicle so we chose to buy one of these. The overall concept of it is great. I feel more comfort having this little bit of security but there could be improvements to make that $100+ a little more worth it Pro’s: - picture quality is fantastic during both night and day. - the range is UNBELIEVABLE! Incredible wide angle lens! - although sometimes hard to make out convos from farther away, the sound quality otherwise is great! - installation was beyond easy Con’s - setup was time consuming. I bought the ring/chime bundle. The ring took 20+ minutes to setup/download and the chime was about 10+ minutes to setup/download - the app can be very frustrating with not working. I click the pop-down notification and it either buffers or takes forever to load. My husband has had a lot of failures when trying to communicate to whoever rang. This is most bothersome to me due to me being very nervous with kids near my brand new vehicle. - i think it is slightly overpriced for how it looks, feels and the program.
title: Great picture, flawed app

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Juan Camilo
content: Product as expected, the installation is super easy, very clear instructions. It gave me trouble that my old wires were too short to connect to the new ring. Ring instructions tells you to use the “included” wires and connectors. MINE DIDN’T INCLUDE ANY...so I had to stop installation and go buy some. Be prepared before you start!
title: Didn’t include wire extensions

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kc
content: I have always always wanted a ring doorbell. I am so excited to have it. Especially with having Amazon packages show up, it’s a nice safety precaution.  Also I don’t have a peephole... I have a window but I don’t want people to see me sticking my face through it. Great safety & privacy. Even helps when I want to see if the trash collectors have picked up my trash, so I can retrieve my barrels quickly. Love it. By the way beautiful color I got the oil to rub bronze.❤️❤️❤️  Lastly I can’t believe you got it Amazon.dot along with the purchase, it was fantastic to have an extra one. I have them throughout my house to listen to Holehouse music which I adore👍
title: Gorgeous color -easy install -great safety - Works perfectly

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kevin B. Hanson
content: the only thing we dislike is that on a windy day it picks up our U.S. flag flying on the front porch.  That's an easy fix to relocate the flag.  The picture quality is excellent on our phone.  I was able to use the existing doorbell wiring & transformer which will save us the effort of recharging the doorbell battery.  We love it and would recommend this solution to anyone out there.  This should be the last doorbell system we'll ever have to purchase.
title: notifies when a delivery is made on front porch

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Johnny Wu
content: So, I got this put together for about 45 mins, the reason was the old system we have had some issue with the power wiring system so took me a bit of time to make it work. the setting up with the app is not hard, but it failed to tell you that you can just use the ring without any wiring (just have to charge it every certain time) or wired to the old doorbell system. The app setup for first person is easy, BUT you get to need to get a code to continue via email (not text), and so you go back and forth a bit, then from the app it takes you to the website and back on. so that was a pain, I think they could've speed up the process. No where in the manual say that your ring do not come with more than 30 days video saving feature, unless you pay $30/year for 1 device, which isn't bad but it should be better explained. It wasnt easy to explain either when you tap to check out the plus feature... You have to log out and then be able to see the features from plus and other plan. Viewing angle definitely is worth it, it can see my entire back porch area.
title: not hard to set it up but the manual is least to be desired

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Andrew C
content: I upgraded from my 4 year old RING doorbell, and the quality in video is at least 5x's better (no scientists were hurt in the estimating of these numbers).  But seriously, the step up in wifi quality and from 720-1080p makes a huge difference.  I just wish the plates were interchangeable.  but no big deal, as per usual the install was pretty easy.  If you are on the fence about upgrading, I would highly recommend it.
title: So much better than the first Ring doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: J Wilder
content: It was easy to set up. The battery life this far is good. I can eliminate a security camera I had out front. I don't know enough about how this ties into the neighborhood but I will do some more reading. I need to adjust the alerts so I don't get buzzed on my phone to let me know there is a fire the next town over in the middle of the night. The photos are outstanding in clarity. There is a slight lag, but it I can live with it.
title: Like my Ring

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Rachel R. Pettigrew
content: Pros: Easy to install Doesn’t require existing doorbell wiring but will work with it Highly customizable motion sensing Cons: Sometimes the video takes a long time to load for live view. I have VERY high speed internet and no problems with lags or buffering on anything else. This is a Ring-specific issue Doesn’t have a removable battery (you have to remove the whole unit). I’m sure this is a marketing scheme so you have to buy a whole new unit when the battery wears out. When I went to remove the unit for charging, it flipped off the mounting bracket, did a somersault and landed on the concrete porch - not ideal. You have to pay for a subscription just to be able to save recordings and pictures. It’s not outrageous, but I think $20 a year would suffice for the minimal service. If you’re wiring into an existing doorbell setup, this would work sufficiently. Otherwise I would recommend looking for a model with removable rechargeable batteries.
title: It’s sufficient but leaves a bit to be desired

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: jared
content: the motion sensors and zones are terrible! either i pick up the wind blowing or miss the package that got dropped off...  after a month of tinkering with the settings i just said screw it! the free trial period of getting notifications for each movement seemed cool at first, but very quickly got annoying because of the crappy motion sensing... but ya, it connected to my wifi just fine... it also installed pretty easy in place of my old-school doorbell. i am likely to replace this with a better one soon enough... oh, and no way am I paying a monthly subscription for this crap!
title: i regret this purchase!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Bill
content: I bought this when it launched, and while the setup was a bit of a pain because newer Android phones have some weird wifi setting that breaks setup, it worked great for 2 months. For some reason last night at 4:30am (the last image i got from the doorbell on a nice clear night) it decided to just stop working. I'll attempt to contact Ring and get a replacement and update my review later. Update: Received replacement as Ring customer service was very helpful, bought a rain blocking accessory, and everything up and running again. Fingers crossed it stays this time!
title: Worked great for 2 months, then just stopped working. Now have replacement.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Scorpio
content: Cons, Motion sensing and triggered recording is bad. Did not pick up people moving further than 8 feet and when closer the recording is delayed and many times u see the person leaving already but not coming in. Setting make u choose 30 feet of motion but the only thing picked at 30 feet were big dark trucks. If when hard wired yh motion sensors are bad. Not battery saving thing. - it's huge. 5". Pictures seen to be smaller. - Wifi reception seems to be weak and u need a nearby router or extender. Pros. Easy install and hard wired and u keep ur old chime. Easy setup. Very good picture, day and night. Very good talk and listen function. Don't get this if u want more of security features. This is simply a doorbell with camera that works when someone waits for an answer at the door. If u want something more for security then get something else that would record better and maybe even 24/7.
title: Works well as an expensive doorbell camera but not

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jam Meister
content: The (doorbell) product itself is excellent.  Well made, performs well, slick Apple-style packaging.  However...the fact that I have to pay Ring $3/month to record video is a major bait-and-switch.  I'm sure there was fine print describing this requirement, but I never thought to look for a feature that should be provided for free.  Why am I paying someone to access videos that are likely stored in a device that I own?  It'd be like buying a PC and paying HP a monthly fee to read my files.  The video record feature is essential for this device, so I'll have to pay the ransom.
title: You Have to Pay Ring to Record/View Video

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: P M
content: Disappointed with motion sensing. The doorbell function works very well. Communication through the doorbell is adequate and motion sensing right at the door is fine. Motion sensing in the front yard is poor. I’ve tried and tried to adjust this without success. It won’t sense a person walking across the yard 30’ away yet triggers every time a car passes 75’ away.
title: Disappointed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Yvis Asin
content: OK, for the price you have a pretty cool tool. Easy to install and connect with your phone a BIG PLUS. When in the baseman I used to miss the door bell now I get notification if someone is at the door and choose to open or not specially when with the kiddos. Great camera tool for the price to see packages, GOOD quality camera day and night.  for price I gave it a 5 stars =) Best part is when you are away you have a good security device on  your phone!
title: COOL TECH

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Ash
content: First Ring was defective. Had to ship it back and wait weeks for a new one. It lost connection to wifi randomly during an update or something and stopped working. Had to take it off and reset it... again. It kept detecting cars a good 50+ feet away on the street, but failed to see the person walk to my door and leave something on my doormat. So far highly UNIMPRESSED for the price. I bought some off brand camera with the same features for like $25 and it worked better. Ugh. I do like that it connected to Alexa so I didn't have to buy the overpriced chime. One up side.
title: Lots of issues from the start

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kyndra
content: We've had our a couple weeks now. It was easy to set up, the camera quality is impressive, and the motion detection bring us peace of mind. We live out in the country and we were getting word that thieves were targeting our rural area since we're known to leave our doors unlocked (I mean, they're not wrong). We couldn't pass up the Prime Day deal on this sucker. We absolutely love it, even though we haven't had any exciting action other than my old Pyrenees dog waddling across the camera 45 times a day. We had a good snowfall in Oct. and when we went out to play in it I realized I had forgotten my phone inside. I was able to pull Ring camera footage of us goofing around in the snow. It was sweet. We also witnessed our nice FedEx guy cuddling with our dog and giving her treats.
title: Best Impulse Prime Day Purchase Ever!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Felicia
content: Do not make the mistake that I made and get this Ring Doorbell. It does not have a removable battery. You have to take the whole thing in side to charge it and then you have no door bell or camera for security while it is charging. I have purchased the Ring Door Bell 2 before with the removable battery,Highly recommend. This door bell skips terribly with video recording all the time. Read all of the description when looking for a Ring Doorbell.
title: Do not like this Doorbell with the built in battery.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jodi
content: Very disappointed and annoyed! I couldn’t wait to revive this doorbell when it finally came set up was easy and I thought I was done. Nope! Fist thing was poor Wifi connection, ok I can understand that I was due for a router upgrade and did just that. Still poor WiFi connection so I bought an extender, adjusted Ring to extender and all good. Now doorbell just falls off WiFi and keeps telling me my password is wrong when clearly it’s not. Over and over again. Absolutely annoying and in this day and age of technology absolutely absurd to have to go through this. Packing up and sending back! **update 7/7 - called Ring support and talked to a very friendly and helpful tech and he walked my through doing a soft reset ( hold orange button in for 20 seconds) and I was able to reset with no problem. Well that didn’t last long! Dropped off twice in less than 24 hours.  I tried Ring! So disappointed and I even bought a doorbell for my son. I hope he has better luck! At this point I just want my money back to try a different product. 1 star at best! **UPDATE 7/15 - I was contacted by Ring support by email due to my bad review. After speaking with a representative who was very friendly and helpful, we determined that my doorbell was not updating the firmware and was stuck. We also discussed where my doorbell is placed that being a good reason as well for dropping off WiFi. I was sent a new doorbell along with a Ring Pro Chime to help with the connectivity issue and extended the free coverage plan for all of my Ring devices for 6 months. I received the products in 2 days, set doorbell and chime up and crossed my fingers. SO FAR SO GOOD! it's been a week and have been hovering around RSSI -60-66. I then had follow up with the Ring representative to make sure everything is working well. I updated to 4 stars for the great customer support service! I suggest any problems with any Ring equipment to their customer support!
title: **UPDATE 7/15/2020 4 STARS** Constantly drops off WiFi

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: James Muchowicz
content: At first I really liked this product.  It was great as it solved our problem of a broken doorbell.  It was awesome to be able to see who was at the door and even respond when we were not at home.  However, that lasted just until the return period closed.  I have had to call tech support a couple of times and do a factory reset once with them and once a few days later after I knew how.  I have only had this unit since Aug 2020 and the wifi signal keeps dropping.  I even bought a wifi extended and put it within 15 feet of the doorbell and the unit still drops the wifi. Customer service and tech support has been friendly and quick to answer, just wish I didn't have to call them, especially having only owned the unit for 3 months.
title: The WOW Effect has worn off!!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: janice reis
content: i wish i knew that after 30 days you had to subscribe to see anything that was recorded. it should be a basic function, totally ridiculous. i have two other camera systems, zmodo and blink that have it as a basic function. please don’t wast your money!!!
title: you can’t see anything recorded w/o a subscription.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: AZ Shopper
content: Thanks to Amazon going all anti-google, this no longer works with google home. Its really annoying because i have google home speakers around the house and it would have been nice to have the doorbell ring over those speakers. I certainly am not going to be adding alexa speakers to my house so was forced to buy a chime. So much for Amazon putting the customer experience first.
title: No google home support

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Vielka Wilson
content: I like the idea of video recording at your door. However I really hate the issue with the charge...if is in detection mode the charged won't last 2 days.. so you have to spend 40 dollar in a extension charger then drill holes and the whole thing.....not worth it 189.00 all together...when it could bring some batteries that last 2 years and save you some headaches.
title: I wont recomend to buy

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: SaidIt
content: I am not handy or tech savvy at all,  this was Easy to Install and Program. I feel much safer with this Doorbell Camera installed. I got it bundled with the plug in Chime as I did not have an existing doorbell. I plugged it in to my Samsung Quick Charger to Initially charge the battery, it fully charged in about 2 hours. I'm curious to see how long the battery will last. I've had it about 3 weeks and have been testing and playing around with it a lot, it still has 75% battery power left. If the RING floodlights can be installed wirelessly I plan to get that next. Would Definitely Recommend this Product!
title: Would Definitely Recommend this Product

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Pete A.
content: Works good same as the 1st version can't tell any difference in the quality still has a lag in the app over Wi-Fi. But what can you expect? I'm looking for version 3 with the laser that comes out and will cut the hand off or other body parts.
title: Wise investment looking forward to laser option

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: James C.
content: I have had this doorbell as well as the Google Nest Hello and a comparison between the two puts Nest on top. The Ring is slow and does not record continuously so u less the weak motion settings sets off the recording you won't have anything. I have had a full size moving truck show up randomly on my camera without ever knowing where it came from. Also the Ring is extremely slow in reaction to the button being pressed and the time it takes to receive the notification on my phone. The Ring servers also went down twice in the week or two I had it meaning nothing worked.
title: Sub par

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Brianna
content: I love my new doorbell! Its so pretty & the quality is good! I am a female & this was pretty easy to install. I love how it comes with a bit and a mini level. Also, if your installing into brick you will need a hammer drill. At first I was upset because I hardwire it & my doorbell in side the home wasnt ringing but my “ ring” outside was lol doesnt do much good if its ringing outside. However, after google research theres a setting on the app and I had to switch the doorbell inside live.  Now it rings inside!  I am very happy with my Purchase. Hopefully it last
title: Love my new doorbell!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Nancy Miller
content: Given the configuration of my house, I never hear delivery people drop off packages and around here, they NEVER ring the doorbell.  I simply wanted something that would alert me when someone walked up to my door.  A motion sensing doorbell was the answer and this brand came highly recommended.  It worked like a charm!  I was alerted every time a delivery was made.  I would hit the notification on my phone and it would pull up the live view nearly instantly!  I loved it!  However, I didn't see the need to have record of people leaving boxes on my step (I live in an area where porch thieves are basically nonexistent and would stick out like a sore thumb) so I didn't subscribe to the recording service after the trial period ended.  And then the device basically stopped working.  Oh I still get notifications when there's motion....about half the time.  (Seriously.  I've walked past it and nothing)  And when I do get a notice, forget getting a live feed.  When I click it, I get a variety of error messages too numerous to list.  So I go directly to the app and hit live view.  The shortest amount of time I've had to wait to get a live view was 10 minutes after repeated attempts and getting error messages.  It's faster to go to the door.  By far.  But who wants to walk to the door to get a delivery only to discover it was just the meter reader or the neighbor's cat?  So, unless you need the recordings and are willing to pay, you'd be better off with something else.
title: Only works if you subscribe...apparently

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: mjc
content: We love the ring doorbell.  The picture is clear on my phone.  It has been very helpful when we are away from the house.  The motion detection works great.  We haven’t any problems with the WiFi signal.  The only thing negative would be that on trash day, the trucks set it off and it’s a little annoying.
title: Love the ring doorbell!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: MM
content: It started out good but within a month, nothing but connection, camera and motion sensor issues. I got a WiFi extender just to give it maximum connectivity but no fix there. Can’t access the camera from my phone, Alexa or even trigger the motion sensor when I’m jumping around trying to get it to wake up. I’m in the process of trying to assign a static IP which is way more effort than any customer should have to do. I have a feeling I’ll be contacting Ring support to get a replacement or refund. It’s only been two months and it worked for maybe 60% of that time. And by the way, while I was setting up the DHCP reservation to give it a stable internet connection, GOOD GRAVY the security holes in this thing. It’s enough to make me not buy more cameras. It’s a shame because when it is up on those random days/hours, it’s a really good system.
title: DO NOT BUY. GET A DOG INSTEAD.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jesse
content: I had a bike taken from my property so I purchased this ring camera so I could record anyone coming into my property. Be mindful that for this camera to "record" anything, you need to purchase a monthly or yearly subscription which I did. Now bear in mind, this isn't continuous recording either, it only records movement or when someone rings the doorbell otherwise, it fast forwards through the sections without movement or activity without you having control over it. Somehow this camera entirely missed someone coming into my property again and taking yet another one of my bikes. It didn't record any movement even though the bike was in view of the camera and the motion sensors were on. One frame my bike is there and the next frame, it's entirely gone with no recoding of anyone taking it. There is no time lapse in the video either since it clearly shows the time. My wifi did not go down during this time! I can't believe I payed a yearly membership just for the camera to annoyingly ping me that there is someone outside when it's just a cat (and once a fly even set off the motion detector) but when there is a whole person stealing a bike with no warning, that's how you know this product can't be trusted. Either my device was hacked and turned off by the thief, or the device doesn't work as intended. Very disappointed!
title: Disappointed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: P. C. Elliot
content: Well, this works as it says it does, but I am not super thrilled with it.  No matter how much I try to adjust the sensitivity, I get motion sensing constantly as cars drive by.  I have angled it away from a direct view, I have selected "human" detection etc. no luck. ALSO: before I purchased it, I asked around about whether or not I NEEDED to subscribe, and all I found was that "it would work" without the subscription.  It is basically JUST a glorified doorbell with motion sensing if you do NOT subscribe.  This disappoints me very much.  I feel duped, and I wish I hadn't purchased it.  I would have liked it if it had at least a way to see what caused the motion detection for five minutes after the event.  It only allows "live view".  oh. well.
title: works as advertised

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Monica Jeanmarie
content: I had ordered this doorbell excited to have some kind of camera at my house, but little did I know that this would be such a hassle to try and connect to my Wifi. At first it kept telling me that my Wifi password was wrong. Like how could I get my own Wifi Password wrong when I was the one who chose it?! After many times on retrying it finally told me that there was something wrong with my Wifi connection when I was watching my Smart TV at the same time while its connected to my Wifi. Finally I tried going into the Ring/help and that wasn't much help at all. Didn't give step guidelines to troubleshoot but just for a hard reset and the same thing all over again happened. I'm returning it and just giving up all together on the Ring doorbell. Disappointed cause I was really excited to try it and see the quality of it.
title: Not worth the hassle

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Ian Roegels
content: This thing is a hunk of junk.  Going to try and find something better than this and sell it.  The app NEVER connects to the video feed when someone rings the door, it always times out.  What exactly are we paying extra monthly for when it barely works?  We have a good WiFi connection.  It always senses cars driving by, so we’re constantly getting messages saying “motion detected at your door”.  When it does finally connect to the live feed it’s extremely choppy, not smooth.
title: This thing is terrible. Buy something better.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Ped&Des
content: Bought one of these and installed it properly at 4 feet high. It was not detecting any motion unless I was 1 feet away from it. After spending two hours on the phone with tech-support they told me that I had a defective product and ordered a replacement. Second one came and I was facing the same problem. Another two hours on the phone with tech support and eventually they tell me that I need to purchase the ring Pro which requires hard wiring for the power source which is not possible for me. They tell me that the motion sensors do not work for me. This was very disappointing and extremely frustrating. I should have listened to the other people who said the motion detector on this device does not work.
title: Atrocious

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Robyn
content: Really like the video surveillance and that I was able to add my teenagers and my husband to the Ring account to monitor activity. Hubby hardwired it to doorbell, so we don’t have to recharge battery, but our inside door chime stopped working. When company Rings the Ring doorbell we can hear it downstairs thru the door, but as long as you have your phone it will chime. We keep Live on at all times with no worries that Ring battery will go dead, since it’s hardwired...which is very easy to do. My husband can answer the door and speak while he’s away in another State when someone rings doorbell, but does seem like it’s difficult to hear company’s response. Also, if you YouTube a video- it will help walk you thru the steps of setup. We love ours.
title: Surveillance and live playback.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Jessica Dillon
content: I do not regret this purchase at all. Installation was very simple, instructions on how to tie ring in with your Alexa app, also very simple. I have my settings to less sensitive on what it picks up, occasionally I’ll get some cars passing by but I’m ok with that. I purchased the ring cloud to record and view past recordings. I just can’t see how I went this long without it! Peace of mind is definitely there. I will purchase more ring items for my home.
title: Very pleased!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Piggiemamma
content: Have had the Ring doorbell installed for two days and we absolutely love it! Installation was easy, once you download the app - you are walked through with step by step directions. I was worried about installing it in our stucco, but it came with anchors and directions for stucco/concrete installing. The picture is very clear, and the motion detection is accurate. We have not had any false "alarms". My mail carrier no longer rings my doorbell (probably because of my dog) - but now I know when packages have arrived and can collect them right away. Lately there have been package thefts in our area, and because of Covid19 I get absolutely everything delivered. Now I want the surveillance camera for my garage area. 10/10 would buy again!
title: Goodbye Package Theives

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sexy MAN
content: This is the second gen of the original. The mounting bracket holes are the same and it literally took 5 minutes to install. Picture is clearer now and I don’t have the black ring around the video. Speaker sounds clearer too. I attached before and after shots.
title: Great Upgrade over original Ring

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: kshea
content: The picture quality is much improved on the 2nd  generation. I had an electrician do it. The install is a bit different since the contact screws are now on the back of the doorbell instead of on the mounting plate. Electrician did tell me that it should make the doorbell less vulnerable to water/moisture. Mounting on siding was a bit tricky but having had the first generation I knew a wedge kit would be necessary. Please note that generation 1 wedge kit is not compatible with the generation 2 doorbell. Must have generation 2 wedge kit. Read thoroughly before purchasing any extras. Overall, so far so good!
title: Overall pleased

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: mewrex
content: I love this camera/doorbell. The picture is crystal clear. It has alerted me on actual noises at night, but nothing to worry about. We had 1 incident caught on my camera that had to be addressed, but it was no problem. My county police are aware so that if anything happens and they think I might have footage, I will hand it over to them. That is my choice but we have decent police here. This is a great thing for me.
title: Very much needed. Glad I have it. Excellent product!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Matthew Cakora
content: Installation was very easy, setup was a breeze. It’s something that with the recent unrest gives some added peace of mind. Glad to have it. Can view and interact with visitors and delivery people. Should have had this years ago. Will be getting additional units to place around the house.
title: New to Ring very pleased

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Mary
content: I have a Ring security and Ring 2 doorbell for my front door. I thought that this is the same as Ring 2 but its a newer version (2nd Edition?) of the original Ring door bell. I can say that both Ring 2 and this new Ring door bell are almost identical but the only downside I think is the battery.
