I like the option of removable Battery from the Ring 2 door bell as it can still look that you have an active and working camera door bell. Unlike with the new Ring doorbell wherein you have to remove the whole Ring doorbell. However, I got this new Ring doorbell with free echo dot at half the price of the Ring 2. So overall, still a good buy.
title: Great Upgrade from the original Ring door camera!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: richard
content: I will be returning this item because it is a known fact (now that I did the research) all over the internet that the Ring devices don't work well with Samsung devices. Something to do about the audio conversion and output, etc... This is ridiculous and you would think that a huge company like this would fix this. I will be having to switch and buy either a Google Nest or Skybell. Yes, we did call the customer service and they didn't help at all. They suggested uninstall and reinstall and etc. just like any other customer service does. At least they spoke English well!
title: DOES NOT WORK WITH SAMSUNG DEVICES

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Marcus Woodard
content: This doorbell worked great for the first few weeks. Then all of a sudden it notified me that I needed a subscription to use most of the services. Without it I can’t view old footage, and live footage is hit or miss (mostly miss). It does still work as a doorbell and I can access the video if someone rings. But mostly it is just aggravating because if motion is detected I can’t view the live video to see what it is. It just takes forever to connect until it eventually fails. Returning and I will not be buying anymore ring products.
title: Useless without subscription

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Joey S.
content: I don’t understand why so many people keep talking about wiring and mounting. This doorbell doesn’t have any wires aside from the charger that are supposed to be messed with (and the charger obviously isn’t connected unless you’re charging it). I see how mounting may be difficult if you aren’t mounting to a flat surface, but they seek a product for that as well (this is $100 people, stop acting like it was about to have every adapter you may ever possibly need - that would increase the cost for many people just to have adapter for a few). I have been fiddling with it for several hours now and thus far, so good (though I think it will take a very long time to charge because it at half full on arrival it took a full 3 hours to be full).
title: Great this far, charging takes forever though.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Paul Hatalsky
content: I purchased 2 units... one for the front door and one for the back door. Bummer that you have to remove the unit from its mount to charge the batteries. Had I known that in advance, even though the price was right, I may not have purchased them. Also, with the unit that I have on the front door, the proximity sensor is a little too sensitive. Although the one setting is suppose to not pick up street traffic at the distance it’s at, because it does pick up traffic, I had to take it to a lower setting making it not as effective. With the exception of those two issues, I’m satisfied with the units.
title: Does what I need it to do

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Buyer of Things
content: Easy to install but a bit of a learning curve with the settings. Also, as my Router is not close to my front door I had to get a booster (it kept missing motion). Spent a lot of time on the phone with IT for a doorbell.
title: My Doorbell Has an IT Helpdesk

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: W C
content: The stupid app uses automatic setting for mechanical or digital chime, it never recognize the chime. The inside chime never went off, only got the push to my phone when I pushed the ring button. replaced the transformer, replaced the chime , still not working. Finally found a page said to check the device setting and make sure to choose mechanical chime manually, it works right away!! Why don’t ring app ask an additional question about the inside chime during setup instead of automatic setting when it detection feature is obviously deficient!
title: Didn’t work with my mechanical chime system at first

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Beltway insider
content: While renovating and expanding we ripped out the old doorbell from 40 years ago. We needed a new doorbell and this is a nice internet age version.  I get the 3/month fee but I hate subscriptions and I won’t be subscribing any time soon.  My 8 camera security system with DVR records all activity around my house (Free) so I don’t need the Ring for that.  It worked well out of the box but the great rip off is the $30 dollar power supply and further $40 purchase of an indoor chime.  These items should REALLY be included.
title: Works as advertised

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: dlh
content: I have been working with this for a week now, it has missed 3 people coming to the door, no anounecment and no video. the product seems like it just came out of the concept stage, the are so many things that need improvement, the app is like a beta offering.. these should have a built in angle adjustment, I had to buy extra kits to get it to view the location update after 4 mo of use: the video is good when it works, sometimes the cloud site is down and doesnt record, it misses about 20% of people coming to door
title: not what you expect

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Hugh
content: Love the ring door bell,  but having to take it completely off the back plate to charge the battery is a terrible design. Charging port should have been placed on the bottom of the door bell.
title: Charging my Ring door bell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: car
content: Not happy, worked for about 2 months. Been calling and either trying to return it or replace., the number given to call is the worse, you don’t get answers to your questions.
title: Not worth the money

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: nnjbabar
content: Love this little door bell cam. Build is very solid feels sturdy in my hands. Charged it to 100 and installed. Ran through the app setup and linked it to my ring alarm system. So far it works great and the battery life seems to be very solid. Many features that people have already explained. I like that it has a great angle of coverage. I included photos with this review. One is on a cloudy day, one is at night with some lights still on and one is in complete darkness. Hope these help!!!!
title: Great view of sight

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Amira65
content: I just received the doorbell second generation and tried to install it. First thing I noticed was there are supposed to be 4 screws to attach frame to the house but only 3 screws were included. Second thing is the instructions to register and install the doorbell are targeted to the first generation so the instructions as to where to access code to scan into the app were not there. I called the Ring customer service and they had to instruct me how to locate it which was by removing the back frame. Instructions said to remove faceplate which is impossible to do since it’s all one piece. I haven’t been able to continue installing it until I get the correct number of screws which can be 2 more weeks. I’m wondering how much more issues I’ll encounter as I proceed with the installation. I’m not a happy camper right now and thinking of returning it and buying from a different company.
title: Incorrect installation instructions and missing parts

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Denise
content: I had to take it off and charge it every other day. Have had this item less than 2 months and will not charge at all. After writing this review Ring contacted me on the phone and walked me through checking the product until they determined it was flawed. They sent me a brand new one no charge. I received the new one in just a few days and have not had any issue with it at all. It holds a charge very well. I am very impressed with the customer service I received.
title: I recommend this product.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Amina
content: I absolutely LOVE this ring doorbell... I was debating on buying this one or the more expensive one and this has got it all! The night vision is perfect! and at first I did not like the motion detection but there is a setting where you can adjust it... it was constantly going off but now it is completely fine (once I adjusted it not to be so sensitive) but it works great. The wifi signal is working really good too and immediately sends me an alert and my husbands phone! LOVE LOVE LOVE!
title: What Have I been Missing?!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: ArmySStrong13
content: The reason I am rating this so low is because after your free trial you will not be able to do anything but live view the camera. You will Not be able to see motion recordings or even past doorbell ring recordings unless you sign up to pay every month. I don’t see the sense in paying this much money for a camera doorbell if you can’t use it without a membership.
title: Monthly Membership Req’d

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Reid S
content: This is a great device however the wifi strength is poor. It misses some motion and takes long to connect with my phone or any other monitoring device. The video quality is poor when compared to some of my other devices. Three vehicles turned in my driveway and i couldnt even get the number plates on them. The app is horrendous when it comes getting playback. The videos look even worst when skimming through motions from the app. I would have to download the videos to my device to even get a good view.
title: Good motion detection. Poor wifi, poor video quality, horrendous app

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sade
content: Love it. Wasn’t sure which Ring to get at first, but I ended up going with this one because of a sale that was on amazon, and I’m glad I did. Simple to use, I installed it myself (bit of sweat and effort but it was a hot day!) and it was pretty easy. The app is easy to use and the device itself is great. The quality of the camera isn’t A1, I think other versions of the ring doorbell may have better quality, but with that being said, it still does the job and works amazing for what it’s meant for. I can see everything I need to see even wide angles I didn’t think it would pick up. I do recommend.
title: Wasn’t sure which Ring doorbell to get, went with this one

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Pen Name
content: Don’t know why I waited so long for this.  The camera and motion sensors work good and I feel a lot safer leaving my home with the added camera security system.  I bought the one with the chime.  The chime is a pain because if you have a drop in your internet you have to reinstall the chime.  For the price it’s well worth it.
title: Added security

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Michael Johnson
content: The good.....high quality picture even at night. Easy install. Easy to use app. The bad.....I had to purchase the wedges because it was installed on siding. $20.00 for 3 pieces of plastic is robbery. takes a long time to connect to app for live view, sometimes wont connect at all. It's hard wired to doorbell but doesn't recognize that it is. I was going to buy a second ring camera but based on my experience with this one but I'm not happy enough with the doorbell to do so.
title: Kinda disappointed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Consumerist
content: I bought this as it seemed to be highly recommended but I think it's over-hyped. Installation is a bit of a hassle but it can be done after reviewing all the directions. Depending on the layout of your front door an adaptor might be necessary to adjust the position of the device. Video quality is decent. Data privacy is a big concern. I don't really trust Ring and its terms of service. I would rather have a private cloud setup. Overall, it's okay but over-hyped.
title: over-hyped

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: CHague
content: Update ** got my money back. First time charging it, it won’t charge and gets stuck in a “loop”. I’m done, avoid this doorbell it’s horrible.*** Works great if I just want to watch moving cars. The information out there how to fix this is weak, nothing works. Now I find out I have to spend an additional $20 for a cheap piece of plastic wedge that “may” fix the issue. Do not recommend, the picture is great but if it never captures the people walking by or on my porch in front of it, what’s the use?
title: DO NOT BUY unless you want to spend more $ to make it work

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Roxi
content: This was a waste of my time. First off you can’t remove the back plate without hurting yourself and damaging the ring. Secondly, customer service is horrendous. You can’t find anything online easily. The motion section was the worse. Trying to get to the video when your notified there is motion it couldn’t load very fast. I lost connection constantly. The worse part and this was when I had had enough is when yesterday I was vandalized and the ring picked up absolutely nothing. I have been stalked in the past and I need to feel secure. The ring did the opposite. I kept my original cameras up just to be able to compare. I’m keeping the old. Much better system. I couldn’t pack up the ring quick enough. I returned everything yesterday. The day I actually was vandalized and it would have been nice to capture who had done it.
title: Garbage product. Wasted my time and never captured the vandal.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: RobinParker
content: Oh my gosh! What has Ring done! I installed a Gen 1 and loved it so much I made sure all of my neighbors bought one too. After years of super service, my low voltage system quit charging it. Yes, that system checks out fine. I started recharging it and now have to recharge it every 2 weeks. No problem! I’ll buy a new one! The gen 1 wired to the mounting bracket. Once it was installed, you never had to touch it. For some reason, the new ones wire to the unit! So, every time I have to service the unit, I have to disconnect my 70 year old wiring and risk breaking it. I called Ring and their solution was to not wire it up to my 12v system and chime doorbell, and keep charging! So disappointed.
title: Disappointing engineering decisions in newer model configuration.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Daniel P.
content: Fácil instalación también la programación súper sencilla lo único que no me gusta mucho es el detector de movimiento si por ejemplo viene alguien a tocar la puerta la cámara lo detecta ya después de tocar o al momento de que ya se ha ido y no lo graba antes de llegar a la puerta pero del resto todo bien
title: Bien

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Guy in SC
content: Thing wouldn’t even set up. Kept telling me that I had an internet problem. I have 1 gig internet w fiber to my home. 3 Apple TV’s, a MacBook, a laptop, 2 iPhones, 2 printers all have no problems. After waiting for tech support (the phone # is buried) they are sending me a whole new unit..
title: Doesn’t work..

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sirwan Abd
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. Dont waste your money. I purchased this about two week ago, since the the day I installed it ive been dissatisfied with it. 98% of the time it doesn’t detect motions, especially if your not home. It doesn’t worth the money at all! I think its better to spend a few bucks extra and get something more decent. I would not recommend this video ring
title: Piece of junk!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Netty
content: Update 10/08/2020:  after leaving my first review of the doorbell I was soon contacted by Max, a Ring Community Support Rep. I was hesitant to respond at first but let me tell you I am so glad I did.  I gave him access to what my screen shows and we worked together to figure it out. He sent me a wedge kit to try but unfortunately that didn’t work either. I have 5 stairs to go up to my porch and that makes the doorbell see my street mostly rather than angle down no matter how many wedges I tried.  So I switched my doorbell to the spotlight cam and yes I love it!! It gets people on my sidewalk, my mailman even the skunk that walked across my lawn at 2am.  I can’t say thank you enough to Max! ✳️✳️✳️✳️✳️ 5 stars for the spotlight cam After having this doorbell for almost a month now I can honestly say I do not like it. It detects more cars than people. I have it set to only detect people and it doesn’t detect anyone walking on my sidewalk but gets almost every car that drives by. And I don't know how he does it but this thing does not pick up my mailman at all!! It sees me getting the mail out of my box but never him putting it in the box. The HD and night vision is great and I like the option of being able to speak to someone on porch but I wanted this more for security and I feel it is not doing that 100%. I’m pretty much stuck with this since I already paid the service fee for 1 year.
title: Detects more cars than people

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Barbara E. Tennant
content: the first ring door bell was wonderful but wore out in 2 years i think because the neighbors little girl loved to hear i go off and just would just run back and forth so i bought this new one and it has not worked right since i put it in my nurse will be coming over and she is in the house before the ring shows her walking on the walkway to the house, i have had nothing but trouble with this one and i will never buy another one from ring again
title: this new ring is for the birds

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Frank in NJ
content: This works great. It’s every bit as good as the lady ring doorbell I purchased. One key difference here is that my main doorbell has a removable battery for when it’s time to charge. This one seems to require removing the whole unit to charge. It’s not a huge problem, since this is a lesser used entrance- but worth noting. Same quality and use as the previous one I bought for the front door. For a mere $99, I can’t complain at all!
title: Slightly different model...

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Misstcat
content: I got this to keep an eye out on my house.  It is hard wired but is now dead--I have been told to remove it from holder and charge!  it should stay charged with power from where the doorbell was.  It picks up loud truck mufflers going by my house but it has yet to capture the UPS or Fed Ex people leaving packages on my door step--I DO have lots of me walking in front of camera to get said packages that were delivered--Worthless
title: Very disappointed!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: E. Miller
content: We are very satisfied with our Ring Video Doorbell. We are Senior Citizens living in a single house. Previously, on 2 different occasions, we have had someone come to our door in the middle of the night. It was frightening. Now, we can stay in the safety of our bedroom and be able to see who is at our door -- and be able to converse with them. Also we can respond to someone at our door when we are not home. It is amazing. The Scope and Clarity is excellent.
title: Affords us security --

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: K Rapp
content: It was easy to set up. The set up manual was easy to follow.  The chime was easy to set up.  I didn’t have any issues with mounting it outside.  You have 30 free trial for saved videos.  On your dashboard it counts down how many days left  You can pay $30 for the whole year or $3 a month.  To use the dashboard was easy and you can set your zones to avoid unwanted motions such as a car passing in front of your house.  I previously had a skybell which failed after a 1.5 years and decided to get this ring which I’m happy with so far!
title: Not bad at all!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Ken
content: There are a lot of great features attached to the ring door bell and i especially love the night vision it is so clear and consist and other features like the different chime setting, the sensitive settings for the sensors, the view settings, all these are great and makes me feel more secure in my home and in this environment of covet 19 i can see when my packages are delivered and I can keep an eye on my personal property, thanks to the folks at ring.
title: Ring Door Bell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Raven
content: Loved them at first but as time goes by they seem to not work as well. The first month I had no issues, now everyday almost it has issues with being slow, when I test the WiFi it is where it should be but one out of my three rings still won’t connect most of the time. The one that won’t connect will also send me 10-20 notifications at times saying motion detected when I’m home and can see that there is absolutely no reason for it to be detecting motion, when I look at the app to see what it saw it will almost always tell me “this footage is unavailable” . I’ve tried trouble shooting and asking questions in the app but I always get automated answers that don’t help any. BUT my other two rings work perfectly fine with no issues.
title: 1 dud out of my 3

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Zuess.
content: I bought a 1st generation Ring Doorbell and it broke within 4 months. This new Generation 3 has a great picture and really has helped us feel safer in our home during these trying times. Im tempted to buy another one for my back door as my neighbors are always having parties well into the night. Now I can record that and send to the police. Great devices so far. Let's see if still working after 3 months. Also a heads up, if you have problems don't expect Amazon to help because they wont.!!!!! Contact ring for they actually know what customer service means.
title: So far so good.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: JE
content: I saw this item go on Pre-sale for under $100. Not reading the description, I just got it. I didn’t realize that the battery was internal. But nonetheless, I kept it. It’s such a great product. I connected it to the low voltage doorbell connection. Keeps the battery topped off and I doubt I’ll have to recharge anytime soon. Video quality is great, voice recoding is top notch, and easy to communicate with people outside without me having to open the door. (Crazy time we live in now). I plan on integrating this with other Ring cams and alarm system. It will make our home security more flexible and easy to maintain with one payment.
title: Such a useful device

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Carol
content: Don’t purchase this model!  The WiFi antenna is not adequate and constantly disconnects. Read the other reviews on this issue. I’m not alone. Get the version that allows hard wired connection to WiFi with ethernet cable. The instructions are inadequate, especially if you’re going to use a digital door bell chime that has several tones to choose from. This Ring device will work with a digital door chime and most of the chimes available at Home Depot include the necessary diode. See picture above. Why couldn’t Ring explain this in their instructions? Amateur hour.
title: Horrible WiFi connectivity

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Tgrantham
content: ***UPDATE*** I changed form a one to a 4 after eExcellent customer Service helping me to trouble shoot my issues.. I got a chime and now everything works wonderfully!! I would recommend getting but may need to confided adding  a chime  pro too This is a piece of crap! It worked great until the fre trial was over and the minute I paid for the year it doesn't work?! 1/2 the time it isn't recording and I don't even know it?! I find out AFTER the fact ther it missed important coverage .. I called support... WASTE OF TIME... they won't help ACTUALLY REFUSED and Hung Up on me.. support online says to uninstall and reinstall ..DID THAT 10 times 😡😡😡still works about 1/2 the time ... you are better off depending on a noisy neighbor to keep you safe than this piece of CRAP
title: My mind has been changed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kindle Customer
content: Works well, have on 2 doors supplemented by dusk to dawn light fixtures.  Captures color well in lit areas.  Motion sensitivity is good, even picks up larger vehicles going by on the street.  At least 20 feet range on back door, good black & white recording if light is not activated.  Able to easily identify a bandit (raccoon) walking across our deck.  Lights came on as well, so good color video. Easy to check when not at home.  Easy to install with old doorbell wiring.  Don’t like to pay to retain videos and no way to save them without paying.
title: Works as Expected Local Law Enforcement recommended

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: SJ
content: I’ve had this for 6 weeks now. After the 30day free subscription you have to purchase Ring plan otherwise the device is useless. I have adjusted the sensor/motion detection numerous times trying to figure out why it doesn’t detect “ALL” motion and also notifications have significant delay. I’ve charged the device once since I’ve owned it and today the battery won’t charge. 🙄 It makes me wonder if this is the Ring conspiracy and forcing to get newer models because the old ones won’t perform like they should. Super disappointed! Guess I’ll be investing in more Google products 🤷🏼‍♀️
title: Not recording or sending notifications and Battery no longer charges

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Phillip A. Sparks
content: My wife really likes this doorbell and is now considering adding a camera to view our driveway.  It was easy to install. It wouldn't fit between the brick and the door where the old button was located.  I mounted a PVC outdoor electric junction box and extended the wires and that worked out pretty well.  I painted the box to match the trim around the door and it blends in fairly well.  If you have brick wainscoting, you might have the same problem.  The ring doorbell is considerably wider than a typical doorbell button. The factory setting was way to sensitive, it was driving me crazy.  I changed it from detecting motion to detecting people and that is much better.
title: It works fine, Factory setting is too sensitive for us.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: MommaBear
content: I am very happy with the purchase of this Ring doorbell.  Even installed on a side view in lieu of straight on view I get a perfect feed down my whole sidewalk and even if there is a vehicle that parks on the street in front of my house.  Voice feature can be delayed when speaking to people, but not enough to deter me from having purchased it.
title: Love this Ring

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: jsinohio
content: Paid $59.00 for this & it’s worth every cent.  Mine is hard wired, so no battery issues.  Hardest part was I had to add holes in brick (mortar drill included) and I didn’t have a hammer drill, so took a little bit of elbow grease.  But, after that the whole thing went together quickly & paired up nicely.  Excellent video & I’ve got sensitivity tuned to my liking.  Like others mentioned, I didn’t realize I’d need a Ring chime if I wanted the doorbell to ring.  I was going to purchase one, but decided I prefer the silence to a ringing doorbell anyhow (plus I wear an Apple Watch).
title: Awesome!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: greg
content: I have three Ring doorbells and can say they are better than nothing at all, but not at all what I was expecting in terms of consistent reliability and performance.  After a few months, the motion detection has become slow - it indicates motion outside, but not for about 10-20 seconds after it occurs.  Sometimes the doorbell and motion detection rings on my phone and sometimes it doesn't.  Sometimes it rings and it was just a bird flying by and sometimes it doesn't ring when there is a person standing outside.  Like I said, it is better than nothing, but very unreliable.
title: Not reliable

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: former ragtop
content: It took my handyman 1 1/2 hours to install it but it wouldn't hook up with my existing chime. He spent another 2 hours researching it and found out that you had to buy the $200 unit for it to hook up correctly. No one told me that or I would have gotten the one that works. I had to buy the portable chime and wait for it to arrive and then spent an hour getting it to finally connect and work properly. So it ended up costing me $75 to get it installed when it said it was so easy to do. They should tell you all the facts before you buy it so you get the right one.
title: The $100 model doesn't hook up to your doorbell chime

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: QuikDraw
content: I really like this video doorbell. It's easy to use, the camera resolution is good; it even does a pretty good job at night. The only reason I deducted one star is because The app is a bit annoying. It takes four clicks to delete an event, and there's no way to select multiple events or a delete all option. Other than that, and really, it's a minor gripe, I love this doorbell.
title: Great WiFi Doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: momo3
content: I give this 3 stars because it is so confusing on the label. This is a 2nd generation ring 1 doorbell not a ring 2 doorbell. This is important when ording wedge mounts and parts because the battery isn't removable and the mounting holes are different. It works, but the night vision isn't wonderful. And there is a people only mode if you live on a busy street but isnt actually very helpful. Hard to find a sweet spot. It can be hardwired which is nice I found have the capabilities but of your wired are in a weird spot on siding good luck mounting it upright.
title: Disappointment and deception

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sideshow 535
content: 3rd ring product I own.  If you have good wifi, you cant go wrong.  UI on app is getting better and better. Our first ring product prevented a theft/burglary.  Keep that in mind.
title: Cant go wrong

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: N. Wang
content: The doorbell DOES NOT pick up on right moments of motions. For instance, it DOES pick up my mailman's back instead of his face or when he puts mails into my mailbox, which is directly next to the doorbell on my porch. What's a main purpose to have this product? To catch the identification (person's face) of suspensive activities. Obviously, it cannot meet the standard or basic function. It has a delay to detect motions although my wifi connection is strong and an alert notification is triggered when the motion is detected.
title: The doorbell DOES NOT pick up on right moments of motions

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: JFitz
content: Frustrating. I'm seeing in the Amazon message board for device troubleshooting that others have this problem, too. Amazon really needs to fix it. I bought Ring understanding that it would work with Echo, and at least make a chime sound. Repeated attempts to follow the instructions (correctly) and then have Alexa chime when the Ring button is pressed were a failure. No video either.  But at least it's an improvement over nothing (Ring itself makes a sound of some sort), but disappointing. Amazon's engineers need to do a better with Ring than this.
title: Doesn't work with Echo

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Joseph Link
content: Works great, had a few hiccups but was easy to fix. Just take you time. I had to program it to allow more house door bell a long with the bell they hear outside. Also, make sure your close to the wifi box when you program the setup, it works better that way. Very happy, two way talk is great, video is very good on your smart phone.
title: Great camera

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Paul
content: Stopped working a few days after intall. Had to buy a super drill to put it in the brick wall. Lost phone connectivity and nothing i did world restart it. Small house but it said weak signal because doorbell was outside the house 🙄 and wanted me to buy wifi booster but the thing stopped connecting to my phone so 🤷🏾‍♂️ Bought wifi booster, so far so good, basically unless your internet is right by your doorbell you have to use booster(s) then it will be more accurate zoning and not keep sending false alerts.
title: Wifi booster needed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Zadidoll
content: The battery quickly dies unless you hardwire it into your existing doorbell. Unfortunately, the way our house is set up there's no way to connect it as the existing doorbell is embedded into the narrow door molding. This means I eventually have to get the solar kit (another $50) to keep it charged. Until then I'm charging the battery every two weeks. Now you can enable the camera so it only picks up people and this will save the battery BUT it's available ONLY if you're a subscriber. The other issue is that videos are not kept unless you pay for the monthly subscription. Now that my free trial is over I'm not finding it worth the price. Wish I could send it back as it's basically useless now.
title: This is the 2nd Generation NOT the Ring 2

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: eric
content: I’m very displeased with this device. First thing is that there is a long delayed when it sends you a notification of a person at your door. For instance whenever the delivery person drops off a package I won’t get a notification until they’ve already put down my package, taken a picture of it, walked back to their vehicle and got in. Second this device is pretty useless unless you pay for the subscription plan. You loose every single feature that makes it appealing including “motion” vs “person” alerts and it turns into a delayed motions sensor with camera to look outside but you won’t see anything because it’s already gone by the time you got the notification. Without the subscription it will simply bombard you with notifications of “movement” for every little thing until you dumb down the setting to where it barely works. I went ahead and paid for the subscription since it obviously works better with it and to see how I like it in a year or so but as of now it’s been nearly 3 months and I’m not a fan. I’ll probably buy a separate motion sensor to detect movement at my door and hope that the ring camera will actually record it.
title: Long notification Delay and useless without subscription

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Evdog
content: Is nice to be able to remotely monitor the front door.  Have noticed that when the humidity drops low, the range of motion detection increases...just something I started noticing here in the south as we move into fall cooler months.  Night vision works very well.  The ability to be able to talk remotely to someone is quite handy.  Record feature is also quite nice.  Easy to install.  Did not have to do anything to get it to work with my door bell chime other than connect it to the wires that already existed.
title: Cool Product

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kate
content: make sure you set up at the strong wifi signal area, i got weak wifi signal and it always delay when someone press the ringbell, it took me 1-2 minutes to answer the ringbell to get the Live call.
title: signal problem

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Bryan Jensen
content: When their servers are down or acting up, nothing works, not even the Ring Chime so a person could press the doorbell button and you'd never know it.  The XTU Wireless Doorbell Camera with Chime that Ring was to replace would ring its wireless chime even when there was no wifi and because it has local storage it would record motion and doorbell use without wifi.  The XTU also has a hood, Ring does not.  Ring provided better image quality and worked with Alexa but other than that, the XTU is superior.
title: <24h after setting it up, their servers started acting up. Even Ring Chime is dependent on them.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Rock L
content: Overal not bad but definitely not perfect.  The fish eye lens points too much to the ceiling and the unit does not come with any level or angle adjustments.  It is an additional purchase.  Additional the motion detection is spotty.  By them time I get a notification, the object is gone.  Aldo the app could be more user friendly.
title: Some issues

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Carol Power
content: I have always used  the ring since it was available, the original was spotty on and off but the 2nd gen seems to have improved BUT the major problem is very SLOW restoration of the white button. Many times UPS has been to the house, no ring happened and the UPS truck left. THIS IS A MAJOR FAULT!! I did here that there was an app to improve time to reset but I have not seen it. THIS HAS TO BE IMPROVED AND SHOULD BE IN YOUR CODE!  I can only give this a 3 star due to the delay of the white button restoration. Still remains with some problems with installation. I will continue with ring but need the improvements please. Bill
title: RIng Version 2nd gen.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Danielle
content: I didn’t know I’d love this product as much as I do! Very glad I went with this (the least expensive) version... picture is great, motion detection is fantastic (in fact, I keep having to lower the motion distance since it keeps picking up cars on the street!), and installation is easy. I was even able to hardwire it myself so I don’t have to charge the battery at all. And I’m not a handy person in the least. I also love being able to answer the door with my Echo Show. Fun!
title: Very happy with this!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Kevin m.
content: It has a great wide angle picture 1080p when it's working. Half the time the live video won't on the app and ill have to wait 10 to 15 min and maybe it will work. Faster just to actually go to the front door when I'm home.
title: Great when its working

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: p cardaro
content: Customer support is severely lacking. I have vey basic questions and have found no way to contact ring for help and if i try the community suppor chat...tech support is not available at thos time. I love the product but support is non existant. Good luck on your own . ring apparently is the wizzard of oz....one guy behind a dark curtain.
title: Customer support terrible. Product works well

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Barry
content: I don’t know if I’ve ever been more disappointed in a highly touted product. There is not option for a memory card so you’re required to get a subscription after 30 days to see any recordings. Motion detection is lousy. I get notifications for cars on the street all day. Yes, I’ve adjusted the settings in a million different ways. Plus, live view doesn’t work half the time. I get a streaming error often when I pull it up.
title: Doesn’t work half the time, requires subscription to be remotely useful

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Therese L Martin
content: RING, you really really suck. This is not my first ring device but there is no support for this model or any diagrams for even a reset button. I am following instructions exactly and all it does is error out and say to contact support. Live chat says not available and I'm supposed to write my problem on a community forum. Way to go! (TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE)
title: I cannot get this device to setup at all. Says to contact support and THERE IS NO LIVE SUPPORT

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: MeshaEdwards
content: This is not what I wanted. In your search bar I typed Ring Doorbell 2 and thought that’s what I was purchasing since it came up in my search. However , this is the Ring Doorbell (2nd Gen). I already had a Ring Doorbell 2 and was trying to replace my broken one. I wasn’t trying to purchase a different device. The search bar should bring up the requested item not something different. This is just a suggestion for future buyers and perhaps I should have verified it was the right one. I buy from Amazon all the time but this time was I was dissatisfied with the outcome.
title: Not what I wanted

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: KP
content: Issues i faced 1. Live video takes ages to show up mostly never loads. By the time guests go back as well or we had to open the door and see them 2. Alerts come late and video of the alert take ages again to load, even you are within wifi range 3. Bell rings on the device, which is of no use. You should buy chime to get ring inside home or will get one alert on alexa Returned the product immediately after above experience.
title: Not a great product. There are better products in the market

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Lesly
content: Very convenient for when I am not home and I have packages arriving. Makes me feel more confortable that I can be aware of where my packages are and to see if any are swiped. Camera is good quality although sometimes can get pixelated. The app is a little weird to work around as there are many things to go through but the set up and installation was quick and easy.
title: Recommend for peace of mind

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Herman A. Johnson
content: This product was a great value at the sale price.  Easy to install (initially mounted with Command strips to test location) and setup.  Setting the fields of motion works well.  Has been great to use, particularly talking to strangers at the door without opening.  Battery at 60% after 4 weeks of installation so looks like a two month charge cycle.  Recharged in less than 4 hours on a fast charger.  Excellent, very useful product.
title: Great product

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Michael A. Krupa
content: I bought this doorbell camera thinking I could see who was taking packages from my porch.  It works ok until the 30 day return window has expired and then you find out on day 31 you need a subscription in order to see any history.  you can see what is live as long as you are looking at your phone all the time.  Works good if you want to pay them monthly for the rest of your life.  In my opinion this is just an expensive doorbell button.
title: Don't buy this thing unless you want to pay a monthly subscription.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: scott
content: We wanted to add some security without over kill and this is perfect for knowing what motion is outside and the adjustability, along with knowing who rings the doorbell when we aren’t home so we can check on pets at the house after. Also it notifies when our daughters even open the front door and create motion so it keeps us safe home and away! Overall the customization, ease of installation, appearance, security and compatible apps and Alexa use... it’s an amazing product!
title: Amazing and perfect

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Leah Erickson
content: Super clear night vision, easy install, accurate motion sensors. Overall very happy with purchase and I think it’s high quality video! I like that it’s rechargeable and doesn’t need to be hard wired. We didn’t have wiring for a door bell set up so this was an awesome solution.
title: High quality & good purchase.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Chaz
content: i bought two Ring devices for my house. I charged them and set them up on wi-fi and things worked great for the first two weeks. Then it was time to charge them again. One of the Ring devices began malfunctioning after charging with a constantly flash blue light. After allowing the charge to be depleted and recharging the problem was still there. Called customer service in September and they ran diagnostics and couldn’t get the device to function properly. So they agreed to replace it with a new device that should come in 5 to 7 days. Well after 30+ days, two follow up calls, escalation of my order and now this review I still have not gotten the replacement. The Ring device works well when it is working, but the company’s resolution service is not so good. So I feel that I wasted my money on a product that the company can’t properly support.
title: Brand new Ring fails and 30+ days still waiting for the promised replacement device

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Lioness Zen
content: This is my 3rd Ring Doorbell purchase and it is a major fail.  Others have addressed the mounting issues, so I will focus on the problems it has detecting motion.  Sometimes it does and mostly it doesn't - which makes having the Ring doorbell WORSE than not having one because the alerts are unreliable and inconsistent. If this wasn't already bad enough, my OTHER two Ring Doorbells are now failing to give off alerts as was the norm previously!!
title: New and UNimproved model

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Regular Amazonian
content: Look at these pictures within 10 milliseconds. At 7:30:39 PM, all was clear and good. At 7:30:49 PM, it was suddenly dark and a package had been delivered and no one was detected delivering. It wasn’t by drone. Because the 3rd picture is what Amazon delivery took (the amazon delivery picture was edited to remove the shadow of the delivery person holding a camera). But the ring did not detect ALL that, and it’s time stamp shows only 10 milliseconds of a delivery which possibly took about 2-3 minutes. Earlier in the day, a friend dropped off stuff at the door. When they called me, I was surprised the stuff were at the door and no motion was detected at that time 8:40-8:47 am. Very strangely disappointing. My settings are for me to be notified for all that’s going on. Am randomly notified, and when I view the footage, it doesn’t show everything going on. Disappointed.
title: Disappointing: Skips Motion and Big Footages

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: SmartShopper
content: It works really well and has cool app features and integrations but it’s annoying that the battery needs to be charged often and it’s inconvenient you have to unscrew it and bring it inside to charge it every time. We made some changes to the settings to limit alerts and the range of its motion detection which does help extend battery life. But really don’t love that I can’t charge it in its location with an extension chord. When it’s winter and freezing outside this will be a drag.
title: Awesome technology but battery life and charging isn’t fun

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Finder
content: It did not function!  The video signal was intermittent, the audio did not work, it did not ring my existing doorbell.  In other words. this piece of crap did not function as advertised.  The phone rep said it was a refurbished 2nd generation unit.  They will not refund my money they will simply sent out a replacement unit.  That unit is headed straight to the trash.  I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER RING PRODUCT!!
title: POS!!!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: kb items
content: Dislike!!!!! We spent literally 5 hours on the phone with ring to be told our device must be bad and they will send a new one! This was literally on Halloween, we had taken our old doorbell off ... had to put the old one back on after half a day then realizing it was bad!  😡 horrible experience and didn’t want to electrocute the kiddos so then we had to but the old on back on.... we still have no ring 😡
title: Didn’t work!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Rosalie Caldwell
content: I couldn't get it to see my Wi-Fi after 3 days of trying I returned it I have the ring stick up cams and they do pretty well and I was so excited about adding this to it but then when I looked online for help I couldn't get any
title: Ring doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Adolph
content: I was scared I'd regret this purchase as I am in an apartment and can't hardwire the doorbell cam.  But the battery life is amazing!  We are getting about 29 days on average of battery life, and it only takes about 2 hours to recharge it to full once it is drained (we charge once it gets to about 20%)  The picture is nice and sharp (no crappy convenience store surveillance cam BS) and the app has great features.
title: Super handy doorbell cam

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Roshmi Roy
content: Ring should improve below points to help their customers. 1.The notification sound option should be more like ringtones so that people can choose,else people get confused when they visited other people's place/restaurant & they get Ring notification.It was bit embarrassing since I was thinking it was my ring notification when it was not when I was in a restaurant having my dinner.This problem could be solved if Ring allows their customer to choose different sound notification. 2.Rings camera gets foggy at night & you can not see who is in the door till the time fog is there. 3.Since the mounting is not very secured anyone can steal your ring.I guess Ring has improved this in their latest camera but increased the price.
title: Not very impressed

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Amazon Fan
content: Bought one of these because the old button fell apart.  So easy to install and set up.  Records everything if you want it to.  Replay is easy as checking your smartphone.  Very happy with the look and performance.  Also like the feature of being able to see what issues are in my neighborhood (loitering, break ins, stolen packages, cars vandalized,  etc. ).  Would not hesitate to buy again.  A bit expensive but worth it.
title: Image quality is great

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Baazumi
content: I was looking forward to viewing the doorbell in action, but no one rings it!  Everyone knocks, the only GOOD thing is the independent chime (which does not come with the doorbell) which is a motion detector - so each time someone approach's our driveway (think UPS, Mail person, etc.) it puts out a warning signal inside - so its worth having just for that feature although a little on the expensive side!
title: No One Rings the Doorbell!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Yan
content: But it is not easy enough to replace the battery.  Well I know the 3rd gen is better on battery replacement. recording video needs subscription !  why can't I just use a SD card to do so ?  Amazon should provide free recording service .
title: It works as expected.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Lydon71
content: You can find hundreds of search results telling you that the doorbell will work with a Google home and even step by step instructions on how to do it.  They are all wrong, the ring doorbell DOES NOT WORK WITH GOOGLE HOME.  If I am wrong, someone please show me a video of someone actually doing it. Too bad for you when you discover this after the thing is mounted. Had I known this I would have never bought this
title: DOES NOT WORK WITH GOOGLE HOME

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Friend of Amazon
content: Was surprised that this requires the entire unit to be removed to charge the battery. This is kind of a stupid idea compared to the older version where you could just replace the rechargeable battery and continue to have security between charges. I will be returning this for a model when the “battery” only can be swapped vs having my security down while charging the whole unit. Just stupid when the old system was awesome.
title: Internal battery? Whole unit must be removed to charge?! Stupid

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Katelyn
content: This thing is a piece of garbage. What a waste of money. Twice now I've had amazon deliveries and neither were recorded but God forbid I drive out of my garage and it'll record that. It also likes to record all the cars driving by which it mentions is a possibility however I turned those zones off yet I'm still getting alerts for cars driving by but not people walking to my front door. Stupid, stressful, unreliable piece of garbage. Thats what you'll be buying. Update 9/24/2020 This thing is such a piece of ****. Theres a disarm option if you're moving around your front yard and guess what IT DOESNT WORK. I still got notifications that there was someone at my door. SO DUMB
title: Piece of garbage

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Lee
content: I live in an apartment and wanted this for security. I didn't realize that the doorbell would turn red and make noise whenever it took snapshots. Whenever I review the video footage, residents are looking into my doorbell to see where or why their picture is being taken. I wanted this to be discreet. I don't care what my residents are doing, I do need it for security for personal reasons.
title: I wish there was on option for not taking snapshots

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Alan Fiehler
content: Product did not work. Tried to connect repeatedly to my network. Product would connect to my phone. Product could not connect to my network - which my phone had no problem connecting to. My network speed was in excess of 50MPS - according to 2 different network speed tracking applications.
title: DID NOT WORK

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: no_real_name
content: I had a 1st Gen ring doorbell, it worked great until it wouldn’t hold a charge. So I “upgraded” to this one. Or so I thought. 1. Motion detection is useless since it only detects and shows someone walking ago. 2. It won’t connect to my Chime Pro, even when the darn thing is 2 feet away! 3. Who’s bright idea was it to make you take the bottom screws out COMPLETELY to charge the doorbell. Poor decision, the screws are very small an WILL get lost if dropped. Please explain.
title: Horr-I-ble!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Lynda
content: I love the idea that you can see activity at the door without opening it.  However it was picking up movement of shadows when the tree blew near the house and that was annoying.  I attempted to adjust the settings and now it only notifies me if the doorbell actually gets rung.
title: How to return it to its original settings?

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: MoFo
content: During the trial period the doorbell worked pretty good. Notifications worked great, although there was a few seconds delay when launching live view or answering the doorbell it still worked. A couple weeks after the subscriptions trial period ended, live view stopped loading (once in a blue it would actually work), and notifications stopped coming to my phone after silencing them for 1hr. I had to uninstall then reinstall the app to get them to work again. My doorbell is hardwired, with a strong wifi signal and highest priority on my router. At this point I would not recommend others buy the ring doorbell, my next step will be looking for a reliable security camera, or alternative doorbell.
title: If you're not going to subscribe do not buy

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: drjwhal
content: I have another Ring device and that one also has its issues, I thought this newer version would have fixed some of the issues but it didn’t. Even worse I can’t create my own zone area it has predetermined zone areas you can only turn on or off. My motion sensor spotlight has picked up many animals and this Ring never recorded anything (don’t have it set to humans only either)
title: Doesn’t pick up night items well.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Rebecca Rose
content: Love the new Ring doorbell. The picture quality is very very good (picture is from our front porch) and the night vision is so clear. It picks up motion and detects people with accuracy and there are so many different settings to less range or more range or motion and even just people detection using heat. Every once in a while it will not connect (usually when it’s windy) and I think it is wifi related. Overall a great product for the price. Very satisfied. We do not have it hard wired so we have to charge it but so far we have had it up for ten days and the battery life is still at 52%. Installation was very easy (into brick) and removing it to charge is also easy.
title: Crystal clear picture and makes us feel safe.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Agustin
content: The construction quality of the doorbeel feels great, the features are nice and the 1080p camera is very clear (if the wifi is good). The bad part is the wifi reception. I tested the connection with 2 different cellphones just to the side of the doorbell and both devices are getting 6Mbps or more up and down, however the doorbell only gets to RSSI-55 (it wont tell you speeds but rather this % scale of the signal strength). Video and voice connection normally cuts as the wifi signal is not good enough.
title: Good product features with very bad wifi recepction

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Just me
content: I have what I think is the first generation of this doorbell, and really like it.  The image on it is round, but clear.  I moved it to my back door.  On the the new version the view is rectangular, like your TV screen or smart phone.  Love that they keep updating features, to give the doorbell (mostly the video camera on it) more flexibility.  Love how the Ring Alarm System, door bells, and Echo Devices, integrate so well.
title: Love my Ring Doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Henry S. Nowak
content: Not worth the money, they give you 30 days of video recording .after 30 days  they stop the recording, they want you to pay a monthly subscription to record.now all I have for my money is a doorbell with a camera.there are other brands out there that you don’t have to pay extra for video. Sooo sorry I bought the ring. Don’t waste your money. All they want is your money so they can get richer.
title: Not worth it.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Chloe
content: It is nice to know that your place is being protected by a security camera. However, I would say go for the extra money to get a better one. Maybe mine does not function well but the quality isn’t great and it only gets a few seconds. It says you can extend time then won’t let you choose another option. It also never lets me go live. So while family is at my door and I want to say something or if a delivery gets put in the wrong spot I can’t do anything because live does not work... I will probably return this if possible and buy something a little more expensive but it will do what I payed for it to do...
title: Works but I will spend a little more to get moneys worth

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Dana Happe
content: Broke down and got one after a string of car break-ins in the neighborhood by a bunch of punk high school kids. The motion sensor is pretty sensitive and the ability to record and monitor while away from home is a huge plus. Even snapped this shot during a big thunderstorm that rolled through a few weeks ago! $30 a year to have recording and cloud storage capabilities is also cheap. I've seen some people complain about paying for it, but for that price, the services from this product are well worth it.
title: Ring Doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Flor
content: I was skeptical to order this after reading the reviews but it does really work. I haven’t had any issues with the WiFi connectivity. You just need to adjust the settings on how you’d like them. I really love that you can also interact with the neighbors around you, I’m ready to purchase the outdoor camera. Definitely purchase the plate if you will install it on siding.
title: Worth the investment

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Candle 🕯Light💡
content: Love it if I had to compare to other that I recently purchased I choose Ring anyday I see video clearly its does give you lots of alert I like that and also you can adjust that its getting  that time of the year and little extra peace of mind is helpful I'm pleased with my purchase Thank Amazon And Ring for amazing products it delivered professionally handle with care.
title: Buy it try it worth it peace of mind

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Gary B.
content: I bought this product like everyone else to monitor my front door while I'm away.....my wife and I RV, and left to travel in August 4 weeks ago, and I did live viewing practically every day, now it quit.....im 2,000 miles from home......so what to do? Can't do a reset unless I'm there....other camera devices in the house work fine.....so, for me it's junk! So 1 Star, that's it!
title: Doorbell device quit while 2,000 miles from home! Sucks!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Claude
content: I too don't understand all the negative reviews. Image quality is great and super clear both during the day and at night.  Installation was a snap. Mounting to my textured concrete wall was a bit challenging and making sure you reverse the wires so that your door chime could ring, other then those two hiccups installation was easy. Really like the built-in battery and not have to mess with rechargeable batteries, who wouldn'tlike that. Thats the reason I purchased this model in the first place. The only thing, and this goes anything wireless, is making sure you have a strong WiFi signal in the area you are installing the Ring. I have an OK signal and I still connect just fine.
title: Super Happy with Purchase

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Eric!
content: Terrible install.  This new generation has doorbell wiring to connect to unit and not the mounting plate.  This is plain insane and terrible design.  Likely to return.
title: Install is terrible design

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: BKNJ17
content: This was very simple to set up. Download app and connect RING to wifi.  In my case I had to hit the button on router.  All done. Good video and works well. But does loose connection on and off. Yes my wifi is strong and reaches.
title: Great value for 2nd generation

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Robert M.
content: There is a known issue with this device that Ring won't address.  Existing doorbell will not work with this device, period.
title: Don't

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Dio
content: Good motion detection, great picture, good value and OUTSTANDING amazing, excellent THE BEST customer service.
title: Very good camera!!  I love it!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Katherin
content: My roommates had one so I was already familiar with it and had the app. I’m moving into my own house and purchased this. Once you get used to having one, you can’t live without it. It’s very convenient to actually see when your packages, etc arrive.
title: Just buy it

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Patti
content: I purchased both the Ring doorbell with door chime (love that, it has many chime sounds to choose on it, even holiday chimes!)and Blink camera, both wireless. Both are rated very well. So I tried one of each. The Ring won hands down. I ended up returning the Blink for a 2nd Ring Doorbell. The Ring was super easy to set up & install. Comes with rechargeable battery device. I live on a busy street, lots of motion, you can set the Ring to only alert you if a person is detected, but it does capture all motion. Battery is still going strong after a month, at 50% still. The field of view on video picture is very very wide, colored & clear! Night vision black & white, really amazing, it looks like daylight! Ther is a $3 per month charge for recording saving, but this product is worth every penny! Excellent product! Would highly recommend!
title: Great product!

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Laurie Ogburn
content: Heads up... if you don't have your wifi located near your front door, access to the camera is clunky and spotty. What happens is that you'll get an alert that there is a person or motion at your door but when you try to access the live camera, it buffers and won't show you the live view. Additionally, it takes a while for the video associated with the motion detection to appear for viewing. Other problems: sometimes the camera records a motion event with no video (black screen), sometimes the video clarity is really poor and pixelated. I would say it isn't the best first option to use as a camera for security purposes, but if you just want a door bell, it is really great for that -and that one purpose only really.
title: Wifi location is a problem which affects other aspects of the camera/doorbell

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Dakkota Saxey
content: Pros: I love this color!!! It goes with my house & door color so well! Easy to set up, great range of view, the sound & picture quality is amazing! Love this!!! Now onto the cons. I haven’t even had it for a month & it has stopped working. I’m not sure if it’s because it faces the West & the sun fried the battery, but not super happy with it not working so early on.
title: Good

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: john brown
content: It's on sale for a reason, the camera has a late capture, when it turns on there is a loud shutter from the camera activating at times it doesn't capture the video. I got groceries delivered and the camera only captured the vehicle just showing up (yes I checked the settings) other times it works. It was sold on sale because it has faulty parts. The company offloaded this product in bulk not only to Amazon. They knew what they where doing
title: On sale for a reason

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Donn Gueniot
content: I've tried several alarms and several monitored services...Ring is the best by far! Very easy set-up and integrates fully with my other systems, including Amazon echo. Installation only took about 45 minutes for 6 door/window sensors, 5 cameras, 2 outdoor spotlights, keypad and 8 indoor light bulbs. Very easy, quick set-up and everything works great...even the solar powered outdoor cameras and lights! I highly recommend!
title: Love it

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sarah
content: Works pretty good once you get the settings set right for your situation. Battery doesn't last as long as I would have wanted but it's no trouble to charge for a day while you are home. It does have blank spots sometimes overnight when there is no video footage available. Not sure what causes this. Overall happy with it and have suggested to families and friends.
title: Works pretty good

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: dawemom
content: Works good. Little delay between alarm & pic but thats due to wifi situation. Bad parts is that you HAVE TO BUY PROTECTION PLAN for videos to work after grace period. If you dont buy plan, you have essentially paid high dollar for a doorbell because videos wont be on your phone or computer. EUFY does not charge for this!!!
title: Works OK

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Sir Paton
content: I like it because it gave you 30 days free protection plan and it really works you can actually see your videos in the recent days all being recorded. 1 years  protection plan  for only $100.00 cant beat that!! also delete and save. Night vision good but if there's light even better On the dark sides  Just too have a  even better look.. far distance..
title: loving my ring app and doorbell ring feel safe that my family security is safe when home and away.

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: Paisley Rojo
content: This product is not worth the hype by the time it notifies you that somebody is at your door the people of stolen things and taken off already has a poor connection to giga blast Wi-Fi and the customer service with rain through the chat or rude and unhelpful if anybody wants to buy a used ring device you can email me and I’ll sell you mine go with simply safe their doorbell‘s are more expensive but the video quality and connection is awesome ring doorbell is something that I completely regret buying and would’ve given no stars if possible
title: DO NOT BUY! NOT WORTH IT

product: All-new Ring Video Doorbell – 1080p HD video, improved motion detection, easy installation – Venetian Bronze (2020 release)
author: LeeNirvana
